texts.en: Leonardo is 25 years old, married and lives with his wife in suburban area of the San Pedro Sula municipality.  Leonardo has been selling merchandise for three years - he sells Gillette products, superglue, toothbrushes, batteries and other low-cost consumer goods.  Beforehand, Leonardo worked as a bus driver but decided to set up his own business.  He works as a street vendor and also sells out of his home.  He sells the products in boxes and by the dozen.  Leonardo has applied for a loan of 14,000 Lempira which he will invest in stocking up his business with products such as Gillette items, superglue, and groceries.  Leonardo is continuing with his dream of setting up his business in permanent premises in his home.  He hopes to realise this dream with his profits.

loans.use: to buy Gillette products, superglue and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jacinto Heriberto

texts.es: El cliente vive en Machala.  Esta actividad (electricista) la lleva realizando desde hace más de 15 años, cuando empezó a trabajar como ayudante de su patrino, quien le enseñó todo acerca del tema.  Trabaja con un arquitecto, quien lo llama cada vez que existen contratos y además labora particularmente cuando lo necesitan en cualquier casa.  Su esposa lo ayuda en casa, cuando lo llaman por teléfono para algún trabajo o dándole referencias a vecinos/conocidos.  Tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales y herramientas para realizar su actividad.
texts.en:
The client lives in Machala.  His business activity is being an electrician.  He has been doing this for over 15 years.  He started working as a helper to his Godfather, who taught him everything about the business.  

He works with an architect, who calls him each time there are contracts.  He also works in the private sector when they need him in a house.  His wife helps him at home when they call him on the phone for a job or giving him references to neighbors and or acquaintances.  He has two adult daughters.

He wishes to use the loan to buy materials and tools to be used in his business activity.

loans.use: to buy materials and work tools.

loans.name: Dúo Agape Group

texts.es:
DUO AGAPE
La señora Marta Julia de 56 años, soltera, desde hace 4 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la Aldea Los Planes Carretera Interamericana de Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado a delante a su familia. 
El sueño de doña  Marta Julia es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del negocio que posee y mejoras su negocio atravez de el microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA, FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar un Comal Industrial y Gas para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
Agape Duo
Marta Julia, 56 years old and single, has had a tortilla shop for 4 years in the small village of Los Planes on the Pan-American Highway in Chimaltenango. With her efforts, she succeeded in setting up and improving her house. Through her business, she has supported her family and moved them forward.

Marta Julia's dream is to be able to improve the quality of her life and that of her family through the business she has and to improve her business through the microloan she is requesting from Kiva and FAPE. With the loan, she wants to buy an industrial griddle and gas to continue growing with her tortilla shop.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle and propane gas to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Duo Ana Group

texts.es:
DUO ANA 
Este dúo lo forma doña Dora Leticia, de 31 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y es casada, nos cuenta que solicita el crédito  para su negocio de crianza de pollos de engorde que tiene desde hace 2 años, quiere comprar comida y vacunas para los pollos ya que si no se cuida se mueren y es perdida, la comida es muy cara, las primeras 4 a 5 semanas es solo para invertir para luego venderlos pero para eso tiene que invertir y espera que Fape la pueda ayudar.
texts.en:
Ana Duo

One member of this group is 31-year-old Dora Leticia.  She is married, has five children, and tells us that she is applying for this loan to support her business raising and fattening up chickens.  She has had the business for two years and will use this loan to buy feed and vaccinations for the chickens. If they are not looked after the chickens may die, which will be a loss for Dora.  Chicken feed is very expensive.  Dora will spend four or five weeks investing in the chickens so that she can later sell them.  But she needs investment and hopes that Fape can help her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up, and chickenfeed.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Danilo José de 49 años de edad, casado con un hijo mayor de edad, con domicilio en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, es propietario de una línea de transporte  selectivo tiene 10 años de tener el negocio su jornada de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano y realizando dos turnos diarios para mejorar su nivel de vida, y debido a sus bajos recursos solicita crédito para darle mantenimiento a su taxi, brindar un mejor servicio a la población y sobre todo poder llevar el sustento a su familia, logrando mejores ingresos con la reparación de su medio de transporte. La reparación consiste en darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y cambio de llantas.
texts.en: Danilo José is 49 years old, married, has one son - now an adult -, and lives in the Chinandega department, in the west of the country.  Danilo has owned a transport business for ten years.  His day starts very early and he works two shifts per day in order to improve his quality of living.  Due to his lack of money, Danilo is applying for a loan to maintain his taxi and provide his customers with better service.  Above all, Danilo wants to support his family, earning more money by repairing his vehicle.  This maintenance work will consist of doing up the vehicle and changing the tyres.

loans.use: to buy tyres and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a retail shop that sells items such as biscuits, soap, and sugar. She also sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 100,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, and soap for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, rice, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Karla Rosalía

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Trabaja como vendedor desde hace 6 años, trayendo mercadería de Guayaquil.  Trabaja por la mañana realizando pedidos y por la tarde pasa en su casa.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en los embarques de Puerto Bolívar.  Tiene un niño recién nacido de 6 meses.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería (blusas, carteras y pantalones) para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala. She has been working as a vendor for six years, bringing in merchandise from Guayaquil. She works in the morning by taking orders and then spends the afternoon at home. The borrower is married and her husband works at the loading docks in Puerto Bolivar. They have a newborn child who is six months old.

The borrower needs a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise (blouses, wallets, and trousers) that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and wallets to sell.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is living in Lahore, which is the busiest city of Pakistan. He is a gentle and hardworking person and a responsible father to his two children. His children are so young and fully dependent upon their parents.  He always keeps busy, to provide them better facilities, and he worries about their bright future. He wants to earn more money for his children’s needs.

To afford the household expenses and to feed his children, he owns a cold drink shop. The business is going on well. For the growth of the business, he wants to start selling 'paan' [also known as betel quid] and cigarettes, in addition to cold drinks. He observed that in his area, many people like to chew 'paan' or to smoke, according to their needs and demands. He decided to sell 'paan' and cigarettes, also. But he does not have savings to buy the ingredients for 'paan' or cigarettes.

Therefore, Faisal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could successfully reach his aims and his dreams could come true. Faisal is very thankful to Kiva and hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 'paan' ingredients, tobacco and cigarettes of different brands.

loans.name: Norely

texts.es: Norely de 30 años de edad reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de colchones, cuerina, almohadas y otros siendo propietaria de este negocio ella realiza sus compras a camiones distribuidores y realiza sus ventas a clientes fijos y eventuales al crédito y al contado. Ella tiene 6 años de tener este negocio que con tanto esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante, ella comenzó su negocio vendiendo en las paradas de autobuses y actualmente ella solicita crédito para incrementar el capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para poder obtener mejores ingresos y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Norely agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Norely, 30 years old, lives in the department of Chinandega in the western part of the country. Since she was very young she has sold mattresses, faux leather, pillows, and other items. She is the owner of this business. She makes her purchases at distribution trucks and sells to regular and casual customers on credit and in cash. She has had this business for 6 years, and with so much effort she has been able to move ahead. She started her business selling at bus stops. Currently she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital and supply her business in order to be able to obtain better earnings and support her household. Norely is thankful for the help the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to obtain working capital to buy pieces of fabric, zippers, thread, faux leather, and cotton, among other items

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
This is Prescilla. She previously obtained a 13,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time of 19,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to support her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Prescilla dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her youngest child will finish college. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise to sell to her customers, like clothing and health products

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
This is Junalyn. She previously was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy spare parts and accessories as well as pay for maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings that resulted from the loan have been a big help in educating her children and supporting the family's personal, household and business expenses.

Junalyn would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan so that she can buy spare parts and pay for additional maintenance of her tricycle. The profits the loan allows will definitely help her to continue to sustain her children's education and their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Junalyn hopes to eventually have additional tricycles and dreams of good health for her whole family. Every week, she meets up with her loan co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business, a meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle spare parts and maintenance.

loans.name: Rodema

texts.en:
Rodema is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She used her loan in buying spare parts for her tricycle. Her income from the loan helped in the education of her children and in their everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rodema hopes to have more tricycles and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он родился и вырос в сельской местности. И по сей день проживает там. В данный момент у него уже взрослые дети. Старший сын Шарифа находится за пределами страны в Российской Федерации. Уехал он туда на заработки, так как по нашим традициям старший сын семьи должен помогать своим родителям. Жена Шарифа очень добрая женщина, заботливая мать и жена. Она работает колхозницей на поле. Несмотря на то, что у Инобат практически не хватает времени на хозяйственные дела, она как настоящая сельская женщина  старается успеть по всем делам. И муж Шариф, и её дети и все родственники довольны ею. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание своей семьи Шариф уже долгое время занимается собственным делом. Он занимается откормом мелко рогатого скота. Шариф начал свое дело начал с маленького оборота, с малыми количеством скота. Но так как ему понравилось это занятие, увидев что это дело прибыльное он решил умножить количество своего скота и расширить свой бизнес. Но ему не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому Шариф обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку скота. Шариф очень надеется на положительный результат, и он с радостью оправдает доверие, выраженное ему и обещает быть ответственным клиентом.
texts.en: Sharif is a hardworking and happy man, who is 42 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He was born and raised in a rural area and lives there to this day.  Currently his children are grown.  Sharif's oldest son is abroad in the Russian Federation.  He left there for work because, according to the traditions of our country, the oldest son in the family must help his parents.  Sharif's wife is a very kind woman, caring mother and wife.  She works as a farmer in a field.  Despite the fact that Inobat practically does not have time for the household work, she, as a real rural woman, tries to take care of everything.  And her husband Sharif and children and all of the relatives are happy with her.  In order to provide for family's living, Sharif has been involved in his own business for a long time.  He fattens up small livestock.  Sharif started his business with a small turnover and a small quantity of livestock.  Because he liked this business and seeing that it was profitable, he decided to increase livestock quantities and expand his business.  However, he does not have enough money.  This is why Sharif came to Arvand and wishes to obtain a loan to buy livestock.  Sharif hopes very much to have positive results and will justify the trust given to him, and promises to be a responsible client.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four children, three in school and one who is still too young for school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of rice, tea leaves, maize flour, beans and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, tea leaves, maize flour, beans and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of her jeepney (see footnote). Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance to be done on the jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children's education and the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena's business dream to add additional jeepneys to her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members each week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance on her jeepney.

loans.name: Paul Angelo

texts.en:
This is Paul Angelo. His previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for his business. His income was very useful for his family's everyday expenditures. His wife is very supportive of him, helping him to generate income for their family.

He would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their 'tricycle' unit and also to buy some equipment in their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Paul Angelo hopes to have additional 'tricycles' and dreams of always having a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and  the maintenance of his 'tricycle'.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane appreciates the loan funds she received from lenders at Kiva that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 30,000 to purchase five sacks of charcoal for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es: El cliente es de la zona de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó su actividad por la falta de empleo, tuvo unos pequeños ahorros los cuales los invirtió para montar una tienda y panadería.  Es casado y su esposa lo ayuda siempre en el negocio.  Tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  En un futuro, desea incrementar su negocio de tal forma que su tienda sea la referente del área donde viven.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de insumos de panadería como harina y mantequilla.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the District of Fortín in Guayaquil. He started his business because he lacked a job. He used a small amount of his savings and invested it in a store and bakery. The borrower is married and his wife always helps him in his business. They have two children who attend a state school in the area. In the future, he wants to increase his business so that his shop can serve as an example in the area where he lives.

The borrower needs a loan so that he can buy supplies for his bakery, such as flour and butter.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is 34 years old and a father of three children. He works as a farmer and his wife has been very supportive of him, while she is taking care of their pigs, as an additional source of income. He has been in the farming business for more than three years. Both of them are striving hard for the development of their living status. For the past year, the income he generated from farming has been used in the repair of their small house. 

Because of financial constraints, he is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his farm and an additional pig for his wife to raise. With the help of this requested loan, he hopes that he can obtain abundant harvest next cropping season to gradually improve their status of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his farm and an additional pig for his wife to raise.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet, 44, is married to a bus driver, and they are blessed with five children. Juliet is in the retail business, specifically a general store. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and earns a net income of 1,000 PHP per day. She also sells bananas in their village for additional income, but due to insufficient capital she would like to ask for a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase sugar, coffee, canned goods, and beverages to sell at her store. Juliet is hoping that her business will continue to grow so that she can earn more income from it.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, canned goods, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rey Ann

texts.en:
Rey Ann is 26 years old and single. She has one child. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business of weaving and selling nipa (hut-construction panels made of woven leaves) in the local community. She's been with her business for years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month.

Rey Ann joined GDMPC and successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy raw materials for her nipa-weaving business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan, which she used to buy more raw materials, and finished products to resell. She hopes in the future to have a better life and to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making nipa, and finished nipa to resell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian, who works hard to support her three children, is married and buys corn to sell in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp to have as a backup  in case of emergency. 


Vivian is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will not only save money but also help the environment and reduce health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is 32 years old and married. She helps generate income for her family by selling various types of clothing. She has been expand her business, but has lacked the capital to do this. She has already taken out and repaid one loan, and is applying for a second for $1,000 to buy more items to sell such as towels, shirts, pants, trousers, shorts and sleeves. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) and the help it offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy towels, shirts, pants, trousers, shorts and sleeves to sell.

loans.name: Waqas

texts.en:
Waqas is a 33-year-old married man and the father to three children. His is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Waqas owns a cloth shop in the market; he sells fancy and high quality cloth. Some potential customers turn out to be quite poor, and they do not purchase after learning the price of Waqas' wares. He does not compromise upon his quality and rates and does not sell below a reasonable purchasing point, but at the same time he requests his customers and does not like to refuse them. 

To win these customers' confidence and avoid having to turn them away, Waqas wants to start a low rate cloth stall in front of his shop. This will allow customers who do not have enough purchasing power to still buy cloth easily.
 
Waqas invests his savings and profit back into his current business but does not have enough money to start the new stall. For this purpose he wants financial help from Kiva, so he contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, who coordinates between Kiva and the borrowers. 

Waqas is very delighted to have this opportunity and thankful to both Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell.

loans.name: Zeni

texts.en:
Zeni is a widowed woman with nine children, none of whom attends school. She lves in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the last three years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, and transportation is her greatest challenge.

She is requesting a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. The profit from her business will definitely help her provide for her family's daily needs. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq is 42 years old, hardworking and honest. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He owns a jewellery shop which is the only source of income for him and his family. He sell a variety artificial jewellery, including ear rings, rings, necklaces and bangles. He wants to buy new varieties of jewellery for his shop. Currently, he has only older styles, and this hinders his business. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy new items to sell. By doing this, he will be able to increase his net income and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, a  49-year-old mother of two who lives in Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines where she is married to Joseph. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Marilyn is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

  
Marilyn operates an accessories retail business selling beaded jewelry such as necklaces. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons  attracted by her low selling prices and the many choices she offers. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.


To help her continue operations of her business, Marilyn is requesting a Php 25,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her inventory. 


Marilyn hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups consisting of  15 to 30  community partners who meet on a weekly basis to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the materials needed to make accessories.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Maryce, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children - a boy and three girls who are in school. For four years now, Maryce has been running a pharmacy business. She is doing fine in this project. She starts working from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair return per month.
 
This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Maryce used her previous loans to buy more pharmacy medicines and has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. With the business profits received, Maryce managed to cover home and school expenses. She also used part of the profits to start building her house. She will use this loan to buy more pharmacy stock. 

Maryce dreams that one day, she will be able to expand her business by having another branch.
Maryce will share this loan with her loan group, Waefeso, which has 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more pharmacy stock.

loans.name: Narcisa Dalila

texts.es: Narcisa Dalila de 57 años de edad con domicilio en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país es propietaria de una pulpería donde productos del consumidor como: granos básicos, productos congelados, golosinas entre otros,  además se dedica a la venta de comida los fines de semana donde ofrece tres tipos como son: sopas, carnes asadas y comidas secas. Es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, de buenos principios  y con deseos de superación. Inicio su negocio con la venta de cuajadas, posteriormente vendía mercadería en general y fue así como pudo poner su pulpería y vender comida ella solicita el crédito para fortalecer su capital de trabajo en la compra de un cerdo pequeño y productos de consumo para la pulpería como: arroz, azucar, aceite, golosinas, productos congelados entre otros, al igual  de poder mejorar sus ingresos, Narcisa  está muy agradecida por la ayuda que los Inversionistas Kivas le brindan a personas de escaso recursos y países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo
texts.en:
Narcisa Dalila, 57, lives in the department of Chinandega in the western part of the country.  She's a hardworking and responsible woman of good principles and with a desire for self-improvement.

Delia owns a grocery store where she sells consumer products such as basic grains, frozen products, sweets, and others.  She also sells food on the weekend, offering three types: soup, broiled meat, and dried food.  She started her business selling cheese.  Later she sold general merchandise, which is how she managed to set up her grocery store and sell food.

She's requesting the loan to strengthen her working capital by buying a small pig and food for the grocery store such as rice, sugar, oil, sweets, frozen products, and other things.  She also wants to be able to improve her income.

Narcisa's very grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a decent means for work.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, detergent, oil, and other products

loans.name: Munaypata Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUNAYPATA II”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas, venta de frutas, producción de mantas, venta de comida, venta de papa, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una vecina que es socia de la institución y le hablo del trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de arreglo de salones para eventos sociales; este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente  con su hermana pero cuando se casó decide establecer su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cintas de agua) que adquirirá de la frontera Perú – Bolivia y posteriormente hará en el servicio a los salones que requieran el servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y la atención médica.
texts.en:
The "Munaypata II" communal bank will start its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima office. It is composed of eight members and it is directed by a board, of which Cristina is the President. The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses. Among them are selling beds, selling fruit, making blankets, selling food, selling potatoes, and a grocery store.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microentrepreneurs, of which Cristina is one. She says that eighteen years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a neighbor who is a member of the institution and who spoke to her about the work they do. Currently she has a business arranging function rooms for social events; she started this business with her sister, but when she got married, she decided to establish her own business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (buying ribbon) that she will acquire on the Peru - Bolivia border and subsequently use in function rooms that need it. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan area and the medical care.

loans.use: to buy ribbon

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 38 years old, married, and a father of three children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 26,000. Jeremiah was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES 100,000 to buy additional dairy cows for his business. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his farming activities. Jeremiah's goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming, with a view of increasing his income to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional dairy cows for his business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a widowed mother and has grownup children who help her in the retail business. With her daughter, she has run a store selling various grocery items, fruits and vegetables too. She is very determined about achieving a good income but has insufficient funds. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, breads and soft drinks to sell. In the future, Flora would like to make her business more profitable and continue providing good products and services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella, 48 years of age, is married to a government employee and they are blessed with seven children. She's been in the duck raising business for almost three years. She earns a net income of PHP 200 when she sells two ducks. Estrella would like to improve her business. That's why she wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase duck feed. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more income to provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase duck feed

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 34, the mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible daughter, wife and mother. She keeps engaged in her daily routine work; in fact, she has to do all the tasks alone, and that is why she gets so tired daily. She has to look after her young children, old parents and the brothers of her husband. She wants to purchase a separate house for her family in which she could feel at ease and relaxed. But her husband’s job is unsatisfactory for getting a high income.

She wants to help her husband with the growth of his business. Her husband owns a medical store in which he sells various kinds of medicine. His medical store is near a medical clinic and most of the customers are referred by the doctor of that clinic. Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high cost.

Nazia knows that her husband would be able to earn a maximum profit if he offered these missing tablets. Therefore she requested a loan for her husband. She hopes that her husband would be able to buy medicine so that he could earn a maximum profit. 

Nazia hopes that through the amount of profit she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Bordemar Group

texts.es: Lea, quien aparece parada y con una bufanda de colores al costado derecho de la fotografía, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bordemar, el cual se ubica en Castro, que es una comuna de Chiloé, de la Región de los Lagos. Este Banco Comunal tiene diferentes rubros dentro de los cuales cabe destacar la venta de libros, tejidos, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, accesorios y joyas. Lea teje y hace manualidades de goma eva y cojines con la técnica de Capitoné,  comenzó hace aproximadamente 15 años y aprendió de su madre y tías, ya que todas son tejedoras, ella dice que lo llevan en la sangre. Además ha participado de diversos talleres en donde ha aprendido variadas técnicas. Comenta que no ha tenido mayores problemas, ya que siempre ha sido muy ordenada con su dinero. Con el dinero que está solicitando pretende comprar lana, y además guardar un poco ya que más adelante, en noviembre, siempre le solicitan poder hacer flores de Goma eva. Está muy contenta y segura de que le irá muy bien en este nuevo ciclo ya que hasta el momento ya tiene algunos pedidos de algunas clientas. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de encontrarse con gente que es tan responsable como ella, en donde todas se apoyan y ayudan.
texts.en:
Lea's standing up at the right of the photograph and wearing a multi-colored scarf.  She belongs to Bordemar Communal Bank, located in Castro, a community in Chiloé, in the Los Lagos region.  This communal bank has different areas, a few of which stand out: book sales, knitting, perfume sales, clothing sales, accessories, and jewelry.

Lea knits and makes crafts out of EVA foam and quilted cushions.  She started about 15 years ago and learned from her mother and aunts, because all of them knit.  She says it's in her blood.  She also has participated in a variety of workshops in which she has learned different techniques.  She says she hasn't had major problems because she has always been very organized with her money.

With the money she's requesting she plans to buy wool.  She'll also save a little because later, in November, people always ask her to make flowers out of EVA foam.

She's very happy, and sure that this new loan cycle will go very well for her because at the moment she already has a few customer requests.  What she has enjoyed most about being able to work with Fondo Esperanza is meeting people as responsible as she is and who support and help each other.

loans.use: to buy wool and EVA foam

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man. He has worked at a local institute since 2009, and at the same time he is pursuing his education. Even though he works really hard in order to gain enough money to be able to pay his educational fees, he notes that his income is barely sufficient for him. This is the reason why today he is in need a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Ahmad states that he is ready to work even harder and do whatever is necessary just to reach the educational level that he wants. In the future, he is planning to work at a proper company to gain good experience in his field and at the same time earn enough income to be able to help his parents with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his courses at the university

loans.name: Fidenciano

texts.es:
Fidenciano es un hombre de 56 años, está casado y vive con su esposa en su casa construida a base de adobe. Fidenciano se dedica a la agricultura en una localidad cercana en donde produce distintos productos rentables de su zona como  plantas de cacao y distintos árboles frutales. Esta actividad lo desempeña hace más de 30 años y siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su esposa logrando tamben contratar trabajadores del lugar en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo para así agilizar las tareas pendientes. Suele usar  abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos y obtener una buena cosecha. Los terrenos de cultivo que tiene actualmente son el fruto de su trabajo.
Tiene como principal inconveniente el tema del trasporte ya que las vías para llegar a la ciudad con los sacos son un problema por el díficil acceso. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Fidenciano, 56, is married and lives with his wife in his adobe house.

Fidenciano works in agriculture in a nearby town where he grows a variety of products that are profitable in his area, such as cacao and fruit trees.  He has done this job for more than 30 years and has always had his wife's help.  He also has hired workers from the area during the harvest and clearing to speed up the work.

Fidenciano usually uses organic soil amendments to fertilize his fields and get a good harvest.  His current croplands are the fruit of his work.  His main problem is transportation because the roads to reach the city with the sacks are difficult to access.

This is Fidenciano's first Kiva loan and he's grateful for the financial help he's receiving to get ahead.  He wants to have 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy the organic soil amendments to nourish his plants.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 30 years of age and married to a farmer; they are blessed with one child. 

Rovelyn owns and has managed a retail store in their village for almost a year.  In this business she's earning a net income of Php 350 per day. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase bags of rice grain, canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve so that her income will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice grain, canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, bread, and rice for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 34-year-old cattle fattener and trader, learned the business from her family.  Her customers are markets in the urban centres. A banana plantation provides her other source of income.  


Elizabeth wants to buy more cows to raise and so has requested this loan. Hardworking and innovative, her main challenge is climate change, which reduces her profits.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Basic Information:
Rehana is a 30-year-old married woman.
She is living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

About Family and Financial condition:
She is the mother of 3 children and passing her life peacefully with her husband. 
She belongs with the middle standard family and her husband has only single source of income. 
Her financial condition is neither good nor bad. Her husband earns enough to feed her family.

Why Need to Take a Loan:
Actually, now her young children are grown and started to going to school. It is a new expense for her husband, to meet school fee expenses, and the expenses of their books are out of his earning capacity.
So her husband decided to grow his sheltering business but he does not have savings or extra capital for further investment. 
Therefore, Rehana requested a loan from the BRAC Pakistan, who is the field partner of BRAC Pakistan. 
Rehana is very thankful to the Kiva because now she is ready to meet new expenses.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards for sheltering services.

loans.name: Yaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YARITAS”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida brosther, producción de mantas, producción de polleras, producción de papa y ganado, tienda de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación un familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de polleras; este negocio lo aprendió de su madre cuando realizaba el apoyo en su taller, posteriormente a casarse emprendió su propio taller de producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en: The Yaritas communal bank will start its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is led by a directing board. Paulina is the president. The businesses that the group members have are varied. Among them are: selling fried food, making blankets, making traditional multi-layered skirts, growing potatoes and raising cattle, and having a food stand. The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners of which Paulina is one. She says that this is the first time that she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a family member who is part of the institution. Currently, she has a sewing business and sells "polleras", traditional multi-layered skirts. She learned this business from her mother when she helped in her workshop. After marrying, she started her own workshop. The loan that she will take out is to increase capital to buy fabric which she will buy in the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. After she makes them, she will sell them from her establishment. This work allows her to have the resources to support her household, since she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Deogratias, who is in his mid 40s, is married with four children -- two sons and daughters -- who are in school. For a period of six years now, Deogratias has been running a grocery business selling beers, waters and spirits. He has added another business, a retail shop selling more consumable and small durable items. He is really working hard and employs a few helpers in both businesses. Deogratias's businesses run from 7 a.m.  to 11 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a good return each month. 

This is Deogratias's fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock his grocery items, repair his grocery toilet and start his retail shop business. Deogratias's business profit, reinvested back into the business, covered home and school expenses. He will use this loan to buy more drink inventory and to put tiles in his grocery toilet. Deogratias dreams that one day he will be able to improve much on his grocery business by adding a guest house in the same place. 

Deogratias will share this loan with his loan group, Wito, which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more drink inventory and to put tiles in his grocery toilet

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny enjoys her food vending activity and hog-raising business. She has operated her food vending for five years, while she has been in the hog-raising business for three years. The income she has generated from her businesses has been used to cover all her family's household expenses and school allowances of two of her children.

Jenny is 32 years of age, married and blessed with three children. As her children grow, her need for additional capital also increases. To sustain her family and give her children a quality education, she works hard in the business to be able to achieve her business goals. Therefore, she is asking for a loan which will be use to purchase "donut" and "empanada" breads for her food vending business. Jenny hopes for the approval of her requested amount of loan.

loans.use: to purchase "donut" and "empanada" breads for her food vending business.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a loving father of six. He raises hogs to make a living. With this source of income, he is able to provide the necessities needed by his family. But as an individual, he also dreams of a higher status of living. This causes him to strive harder. Now, Romeo is asking for further capital to buy additional hogs, vitamins and feed for his hog-raising business to develop more. He hopes to grow his business with his strong determination and financial assistance of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs, vitamins and feed for his hog-raising.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is 53 years old and is married with three children. She is operating a piggery business in their village to create an income. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for the maintenance of her current pigs. She hopes that her loan will be approved in order to nourish well her pigs and sell them at a profitable price.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the maintenance of her current pigs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 40-year-old single mother of three children.  She and her children live in Kasese, Uganda.

For three years she has been selling clothes.  She started the business in order to supplement the meager salary that she earns as a civil servant.  

Ever changing fashion trends and low capital make it hard to grow her business, but her dream is to own a fashion house. Mariam intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Delis

texts.es:
Ana, es una persona trabajadora es por ello que le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar trabajando en su actividad; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: manzanas, naranjas, uvas, piñas, tomates, chiles, cebollas, yuca, plátanos, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar las condiciones economicas; su sueño es crecer en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana's a hardworking person, which is why she feels the need to get another loan to keep on working in her job.  This investment will help her buy a variety of merchandise, such as applies, oranges, grapes, pineapples, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, yuca, bananas, and other produce.

The previous loan allowed Ana to improve her finances.

Ana's dream is to grow in her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She operates a cereal business that sells items such as beans, rice, and millet. She sells from home to her neighbors. 
With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase cereals such as rice, beans, and maize, and a weighing machine for the business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such as rice, beans, and maize, and a weighing machine for the business

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine (middle one in the photo) is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law (in the photo) and two children (in the photo). Qristine has already been selling clothing to locals for two years. She buys the stock from the city market and sells it in neighboring villages. Since in the villages there are no clothing stores, Qristine's business has high demand. She is very nice to her customers and does her job with love and care. 
Now, she has applied for this loan in order to increase her working capital. By purchasing needed supplies, Qristine will be able to continue her business and will be able to gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothing supplies to sell to customers

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 49-year-old man. He deals in agriculture especially in sales of maize, coffee and tree planting. His business is located in a rural area. He would like to buy 3 bulls which he will breed and fatten. His clients are butchers, schools, and cattle traders. His challenge is cattle thieves, natural catastrophes like drought, and bad roads. He says being hard working and God fearing has helped him to draw more customers and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy bulls

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria raises pigs in the village of Binag. She is requesting a loan of  PHP 7,000 to purchase pig feed, medicine and vitamins to maintain her pig-fattening business and sales. She hopes that she will get the loan which will help her improve the business that she runs. This financial support from having higher sales will be a great help to her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, medicine and vitamins to maintain her pig fattening business and sales.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, aged 53, is an industrious woman who lives with her family in the village of Binag. Her husband is a farmer, and she is in the hog fattening and selling business. She is doing her best in the business to help her husband in promoting their living as well as to save funds for their livelihood and for any urgent situation. Right now, she is asking for additional capital for the purchase of hog feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that her requested loan amounting to 10,000 PHP will be permitted.

loans.use: to purchase of hog feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos  y así obtener mayores ganancias; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: semilla, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
Comenta el Sr. José que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y sus inventarios se optimizaron. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs to get another loan.  He needs more working capital to continue growing basic grains and earn more income.  This investment will help José buy the necessary agricultural inputs, such as seeds, soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and others.

José says the previous loan helped him increase his income and make the most of his inventory.  His family circumstances are the same and his finances have improved.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She faces a major challenge of transportation of charcoal to her place of operation.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mayra Luisa

texts.es: Mayra Luisa de 50 años de edad con domicilio en la departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país es dueña de una pulpería en la que vende granos básicos, golosinas, cosméticos como: cremas, shampoo, perfumenes, pinturas, toallas húmedas, entre otros y mercadería en general como: prensapelos, colas, cuadernos, lápices, fólderes, papel crepe, pega, entre otros ella desde temprana edad comenzó a trabajar y poco a poco pudo ir mejorando su condición económica, actualmente ella está solicitando crédito para invertir en su negocios incrementando más su inventario porque su demanda de consumo ha incrementado , y desea prestarle mejor servicios a su clientela, Mayra  se siente muy contenta con el apoyo y la ayuda que los Inversionistas Kivas ofrecen a las personas con escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en: Mayra Luisa, 50, lives in Chinandega department in the western part of the country. She owns a grocery store where she sells staple goods, sweets, and cosmetics like creams, shampoos, perfumes, makeup, wet wipes, and other things, as well as general merchandise like hair bows, hair ties, notebooks, pencils, folders, crepe paper, glue, and the like. She began to work from an early age and little by little she was able to improve her economic condition. Currently she is applying for a loan to invest in her business, increasing her inventory because demand has increased and she wants to provide better service to her clientele. Mayra feels very glad for the support and help that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods to expand her grocery store, and also to buy general merchandise like school supplies and cosmetics among other things.

loans.name: Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Masoud, a married man with three children, has been running two activities: selling charcoal and operating a small shop selling rice, beans, soft drinks, etc. Masoud has been in these businesses for two years. Masoud, who is in his early 30s, works from 6 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. each working day and is able to make a fair return per month. 

This is his 6th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania and Masoud will use it to buy more sacks of charcoal and restock his small shop business. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he bought more charcoal, a shop freezer, and started a small shop business. He is doing fine and it shows. With his business profit, Masoud bought a radio, mattress and bed, sofa set, gas cooker and DVD player. Masoud dreams that one day he will be able to buy a pick-up type of cargo car.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Green Tomalin, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and restock his small shop.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo, aged 50, is married and he and his wife are blessed with three children. Together with his wife, they are striving hard to earn more income for their children. For almost 14 years, Rodolfo has owned and managed a business which sells LPG (liquid petroleum gas) tanks and oxygen tanks. In this business, he earns a net income of PHP 5,000 per day.  

Rodolfo wants to improve their business so he has requested a loan from those generous lenders which amounts to PHP 35,000 to purchase LPG tanks to sell. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase liquid petroleum gas tanks to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, aged 50, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto and the mother of her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They work hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn owns and oversees the operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney (14-16 person capacity) which pays a boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Marilyn is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney.

Marilyn dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes for a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines to repel the invading Japanese forces. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is from the village of Mabbayad. He is 40 years old and is married with three happy children. To raise his family, he operates a transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been in this business for three years and earns about a minimum of PHP 300 each day. He is happy because through the business he is able to meet their children's needs.

Currently, Johnny wants to borrow a loan to buy a sprocket, tires and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. Johnny hopes to grow his daily earnings from this transport business for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy a sprocket, tires and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, shirts, shorts, pants etc.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old lady; she is very poor and needy. The major problem of her poverty is that all her sons are vagabonds and do not earn a single penny. If they earn then they do not contribute their income to pay household expenses.
 
Shehnaz's husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her and her daughters. He preserved all his sheltering material in a godown. However, due to a lot of rain, the godown filled with water and most of the wooden boards sank under the water and lost their specific shape. 

Now Shehnaz's husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband so that he will be able to buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business again. 

Shehnaz hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. She is is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering materials.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards and bamboo to build sheltering services

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a prestar el servicio de organización de eventos, actividad que comenzó hace cuatro años, cuando sus vecinos y amigos le solicitaban prestado unas sillas plásticas que ella tenía para algunos eventos familiares y, luego de varias veces que se lo solicitaban, ella descubrió en esto una idea de negocio, por lo que compró varias mesas y más sillas, cristalería y manteles para las mesas gracias al apoyo económico de su esposo; adicionalmente realizó varios cursos de capacitación sobre organización de eventos y gastronomía con lo cual ha podido ampliar su portafolio de servicios y generar mayores ingresos, esta actividad la realiza con el apoyo de 2 hermanas a las cuales contrató. María es una mujer emprendedora, con proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito con el interés de comprar activos fijos y utensilios de trabajo (malacate de motor, manteles y cristalería, silla y arco para eventos de quinceañera, ollas, cucharas, cuchillos, entre otros), con lo que podrá ampliar su capacidad instalada y realizar contratos para eventos más grandes, lo que le generará mejores ingresos para seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos. De esta manera María desea avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es adquirir un local grande para prestar el servicio completo con salón social incluido, donde sus clientes puedan sentirse cómodos y a gusto con la prestación del servicio, además podrá contratar más personal para los eventos, lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida, no sólo de su familia, sino de muchas otras personas.
texts.en: Maria is married and has two children. She dedicates herself to providing services as an event organizer, activity that she started four years ago, when her neighbors and friends requested her to borrow plastic chairs that she owned for family events and after several requests, she discovered it was business idea, for which she bought several tables and more chairs, place settings, and tablecloths thanks to the financial support from her husband; she also took several training courses about event organizing and gastronomy with which she has been able to expand her service portfolio and generate more income, she works with the support of her two sisters whom she hired.  Maria is an entrepreneurial woman, with vision towards achieving her objectives, which led her to request a loan for her plans to buy fixed assets and work items (motor, tablecloths, place settings, chair and arch for “Sweet Fifteen” birthdays, pots, spoons, knives, and other items) with which she will have more capacity and be able to take on contracts for larger events, which will generate better income to continue providing to her home's economy and look after the well-being of her children.  This way Maria wishes to move towards achieving her main dream; to acquire a large location where she can provide the full service including the hall, where her customers can feel comfortable and happy with the service provided, she will also be able to hire more workers for the events, which will allow her to improve the quality of life of not only her family, but the family of many other people.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and work items (motor, tablecloths, place settings, chair and arch for “Sweet Fifteen” birthdays, pots, spoons, knives, and other items)

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 37-year-old married man with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Five months ago, he decided to start a retail shop in order to support his family. Frank also has a motorcycle for his transport business and practices agriculture. 

Like most traders, he is challenged by price fluctuations, the high cost of rent and customers not paying on time. His dream is to trade wholesale. Frank intends to use the loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, rice, flour, pork cracklings, cheese, oil, spices, gas as well as chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Marío Dagoberto

texts.es:
Mario de 50 años de edad,  vive junto a su madre. Desde hace 14 años, trabaja como ordenanza en la alcaldía municipal, mostrando siempre disciplina y compromiso en sus actividades. Para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, viaja en bicicleta unas cinco cuadras, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar bloque, cemento, lámina, entre otros materiales para remodelar la vivienda. Con la inversión, mejorar la estadía suya y de su familia en casa para que sea más agradable y evitara que las lluvias deterioren las paredes de la vivienda.

Uno de sus sueños, es instalar una tienda de productos básicos, como: arroz, fríjol, maíz. Con las ganancias espera continuar ayudando a su familia como hasta lo ha realizado.
texts.en: Mario, 50, lives with his mother. For 14 years, he has worked as an administrative assistant for the town council, always showing discipline and commitment to his work. To get to his workplace, he travels five blocks on bicycle. His work schedule is from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm. The loan that he is applying for is to buy cinderblocks, cement, sheet metal, and other materials to remodel his home. With this investment, his and his family's residence in the home will be improved to that it is more pleasant and so that the rain does not damage the walls of the home. One of his dreams is to set up a store that sells basic goods like rice, beans, and corn. With the earnings, he hopes to continue helping his family like he has done up until now.

loans.use: to buy cinderblocks, cement, sheet metal, and other materials to remodel his home

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 23 years old. He lives in Bolnisi district with his parents and brother. Artur and his brother are employed by a local company which produces different kinds of tin products. They both have a small monthly salary. Artur’s mother is the housekeeper and his father is an artisan and repairs damaged cars. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Artur was unable to study for a professional career. As the existing income is not enough to cover everyday costs, Artur decided to start his own business and sought credit among local financial institutions but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start-Up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people and those who are inexperienced to get a loan to start or re-start businesses. Artur's application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of $2000. With the credit, he will purchase a car and will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will enable him to increase his family's income. With the support of the Start-Up program, Artur will get the opportunity to be involved in his own business and to tackle his family's financial difficulties.

.

loans.use: to purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 28 years old and runs a kiosk in front of her house. Isabel is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She will use the loan to buy stocks for her store such as noodles, fish, milk, sugar, coffee, salt, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and water to sell. Isabel is earning good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Isabel lives in a town near the school: her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people including students come to buy.

loans.use: To buy noodles, fish, milk, sugar, coffee, salt, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and water to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 31, is married and they are blessed with five children. She owns and manages a retail store business at the public market from which she earns a net income of PHP 600 a day. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to ask for a loan from those generous lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, fish sauce and food seasonings to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, fish sauce and food seasonings to sell

location.town: Villarta Street, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a 39 year old married woman with 5 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She sells second hand clothes and with the proceeds she has been able to raise money to support her family and also venture into banana selling since the latter business is seasonal.  

Inadequate capital and price fluctuation are her major set backs while her dream is to own a modern boutique.  Dinah is requesting for a loan to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia operates a variety store and transportation business.  She is 46 years old, married and blessed with five children.  Only her youngest child is still studying.  Sylvia's husband is a farmer and driver.

Sylvia has gained income, which goes towards their daily necessities, maintenance to her two units of motorcycle transport and allowances for her one child.  With her determination to improve her way of life and have continuous growth of her variety store, she decided to seek additional capital of PHP 10,000, which allows her to buy necessary grocery items such as canned goods,assorted biscuits, eggs,cooking oil and ingredients to restock her variety store.  Sylvia knows that the amount she requested will help her realize her goals in life.  She hopes and prays that the amount of her loan she requested will be granted.

loans.use: to use in buying stocks of merchandise such as canned goods,assorted biscuit,egg,cooking oil and ingredients to re stock her retail store

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is married with two children who go to school.  She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.  She cites rent and school fees as her greatest monthly expenses.

Maureen operates a green grocery business selling fruits such as bananas and vegetables.  With the loan of KES.20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.  She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Maria Joyce

texts.en:
This is Maria Joyce, 22, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines.  Her partner is Roland, a mechanic.  She, together with her partner, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Joyce operates a food stall.  In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend on cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings and frozen food products. 

Maria Joyce dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vladik

texts.en:
Vladik is from Jermuk town where he lives with his wife and father.  Vladik has been earning his living by offering taxi services to locals for the past 3 years.  As Jermuk town is famous for its hot springs and its brand of mineral water that is bottled in the vicinity.  

There are a lot of tourists who come throughout the year.  So with taxi driving Vladik is able to sustain his family's living.  Now, he has applied for this loan in order to renovate his car.  It is very old and needs to be entirely renovated.  So the loan is very important for Vladik to be able to continue his business.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on the car

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
A $ 1.000 loan is offered to Julieta to improve her business.  She opened her second hand clothing store in 2009 with her own working capital.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like shirts, long pants, shorts and sleeves.  She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a bigger business after several years in the business.  She is living in town with her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts, long pants, shorts and sleeves

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 43, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines.  She is married to Romel and they have children.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Edna operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal.
