En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de rellenos; este negocio lo inicio hace quince años ayudando a su cuñada a vender este productos, posteriormente decide establecer su propio negocio aprovechando su conocimiento en este rubro de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es aumento de capital (compra de harina y garrafas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Yunguyo” Association will start their 15th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan-american Focus Center, it is formed by 10 members and managed by a board of directors where Martha is the President.  The businesses that the members of the community association have are varied, among them are: vegetables and cheese sales, restaurant, purchase and sale of clothing, minibus services, beef tripe sales, stuffing sales, food sales, convenience store.

The loan they'll take will benefit small micro entrepreneurs where Martha is a member, she indicates being part of Pro Mujer for 15 years, joining after an invitation from her niece, who is a member of the institution and explained the work they do.  She currently has a business of stuffing sales, she started it 15 years ago helping her sister-in-law sell these products, she later decided to start her own business taking advantage of the knowledge she had in this type of business.

The loan she will now take will be for working capital (to buy flour and containers) that she will buy in the stores of the city of El Alto and will later bring to her point of sale.  This type of work allows her to generate resources for her family, as she lives with her common law partner and has nine children.
When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the courses about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy flour and containers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the needed products for her variety store. Her income from business helped her in sending her child to school and in the family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Rosemarie would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosemarie hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia used her previous loan to buy fresh foods to sell. She is a hardworking woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods and, with the proceeds, she has been able to provide the basics to her family. Lack of adequate preservation equipment causes most of her foods to go bad. Her dreams are to buy a refrigerator, educate her children up to the university level, and diversify her business to include farming activities. Sylvia intends to use this loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Máximo Braulio

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Años atrás decidió trasladarse a la Península y posteriormente, establecerse ahí trabajando con su hermano en esta actividad.  Trabaja en el mercador desde temprano en la mañana hasta alrededor de las 4 pm.  No es casado y tampoco tiene hijos.  En un futuro le gustaría poder tener su local propio y trabajar junto con su familia.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  Years ago, he decided to move to La Península and eventually established his own business where he works with his brother.  The borrower works at the market from the early morning hours to 4:00 P.M.  He is not married nor does he have any children.  In the future, he would like to have his own storefront where he can work with his family.

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that he can buy fruits and vegetables for his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is a very shy person and in the photo you can see her husband. 

Aynura is 29 years old and has two children. For the past seven years, she has been running a boutique and beautician business. She sells wedding dresses and does bridal makeup and manicure. 

Very often the brides invite her to do their makeup at their home. The car owned by her family needs to be repaired. She can't lose her customers, so it is very important for her to repair the car. For this purpose she is requesting the loan.

loans.use: to repair the car to facilitate her to go to brides homes and prep them for the wedding.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina’s husband manufactures PVC pipes for sanitation. He takes orders and, based on demand, manufactures pipes. He has been doing this business for many years and earns a healthy income. He wants to provide all facilities and higher education to his children. He wants to prove himself a good husband and a good father.

Rubina requested a loan for her husband’s business so that her husband will be able to improve his income and make his dreams come true. She wants to pass her life with her family in a peaceful atmosphere where a shortage of money would not be happen. She will save the profit amount to meet any  sudden incidents and needs for household expenses. 

Rubina is 33 years old. She is the mother of four children. They live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for manufacturing PVC pipes, water and sanitary pipes.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: Xiomara 47 años de edad madera soltera con seis hijos los cuales solo dos están bajo su protección , del domicilio norte de Chinandega del occidente del país ella dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa usada seleccionada negocio que posee desde hace 10 años, ha trabajado muy duro para poder darle un buen futuro a sus hijos, ella se entrega a su trabajo con tanto animo ya que ha sido el medio por el cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos las cuales son al contado y al crédito y las realiza de forma ambulante saliendo desde muy temprano recorriendo comarcas vecinas con un bolso pesando unos 10kilos, Xiomara actualmente solicita crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de: ropa, maquillajes, calcetas, faldas, camisas, chores, cintas entre otros porque ha subido su demanda por las festividades que se aproximan , ella está muy agradecida por la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas le brindan a ella ya personas con escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua de tener un medio digno de trabajo.-
texts.en:
Xiomara is 47 years old and she is a single mother with six children that she cares for.  They live to the north of Chinandega in the western part of the country.  She sells cosmetics and used clothing.  She has had this business for 10 years and she works very hard in order to provide a good future for her children.

She puts all of her energy into her work because it is the only way that she can help her children get by.  She buys clothing in the major marketplaces for cash and then sells it door-to-door, beginning very early in the morning and traveling around neighboring areas carrying a 10 kg (22 lbs.) bag of clothes.

Xiomara is seeking a loan so that she can invest in her business by buying clothing, makeup, socks, skirts, shirts, belts, and other items, as demand has increased for these things due to the upcoming holidays.  

She is very thankful for the help provided by the Kiva lenders to herself, to people who lack economic resources, and to the poorer countries in the world like Nicaragua, as it enables people to find dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in her business; to buy t-shirts, skirts, shorts, socks, shoes, pants, and more.

loans.name: Fozilboy

texts.en:
Fozilboy is married and has one child to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 10 years ago, he began his own business with driving. Thanks to his good service, he managed to gain many customers. 

Since he's had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Now his child is able to get good education, and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 
 
He is asking for a loan to repair his mini-bus. In this way, he will have the opportunity to provide better service and increase his income, which allows him to offer his child and wife a better quality of life and financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to repair his mini-bus.

loans.name: Jonny Javier

texts.es: El cliente vive en Machala.  Inició con sus padres en la pesca, comprándose una embarcación y desde entonces ha trabajado por ya casi 20 años.  Sale en la madrugada y según el aguaje puede quedarse de 2 a 3 días.  Es casado y tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Necesita el dinero para invertirlo en la compra de mallas, tinas y otros artículos de pesca.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Machala.  He started fishing with his parents and then purchased a boat.  Since then he has been working for almost 20 years.  He leaves at dawn and stays out at sea for two or three days based on the conditions.  The borrower is married and has three children, one of whom attends a state school in the area.  

He needs money so that he can invest in the purchase of nets, coolers, and other fishing supplies.

loans.use: to buy nets, coolers, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more tomatoes, onions and other items

loans.name: Mirembe Tukundane Group

texts.en: Jackson is a 45-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is a farmer whose main challenge is unpredictable weather changes (especially during the dry season) and lack of enough capital to invest in his farming activities.  However his dream is to educate his children to a higher level of education and venture into modern farming methods.  He is a member of the above-mentioned group.  Each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.  Jackson is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en: Gadir is 63 and is married with three children.  He has been selling clothing and other consumer goods for several years.  He works together with his wife.  Today their business is their only source of income.  Gadir is planning to add new clothes of different styles to satisfy his customers and raise his income to cover his family's needs.  Gadir is requesting a loan in 1500 AZN to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purhcase new clothes of different styles to sell.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, su esposo de 47 años de edad y un hijo de 12 años. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para obtener ingresos, dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y lo hace de casa en casa por todo el vecindario, lo desempeña desde hace dos años. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa, tales como: blusas, camisas, chores, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio. 
Su sueño es que su hijo logre culminar el bachillerato  ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her family, her 47-year-old husband and her 12 year old son.  She sells used clothing to earn income, she performs this activity informally and from door to door around the neighborhood, has done this for two years.

The loan requested will allow her to buy a variety of clothing, such as: blouses, shirts, shorts, pants, skirts, dresses and others.  This investment will help her strengthen her business.  Her dream is that her son can finish high school and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, shorts, pants, skirts, dresses and others

loans.name: Yeghishe

texts.en: Yeghishe is 53 years old and lives in Kapan City. Yeghishe has worked as a driver for many years. He is married and he has two sons. His elder son is married and lives separately. His second son lives with them and he is a taxi driver. Yeghishe’s wife works at the Water and Sewerage Company. She is the head of the laboratory. Even though all of Yeghishe’s family members are employed, their family income is not enough to complete the furnishing of their house after some repairing. Yeghishe asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy some furniture for his guest room.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his guest room

loans.name: Coka - Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Rehema is in her early 30s and is married with two children.  One of her children is going to school but the other one is still small.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Rehema's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania .  She used the previous loans to restock the missing food stocks.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profits from previous loans to help her husband to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more stock of food, sauce pans, and plates. She dreams of owing a hotel.

Rehema will share this loan with her eleven-member loan group "COKA - KIWALANI".  The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food, sauce pans, and plates.

loans.name: Iqra

texts.en:
Iqra is a 29-year old married woman.  She is taking loan for her husband’s auto rickshaw’s body maintenance.  Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years.  Her husband likes to drive in the night time because at night time the passengers pay more than they pay during the day time.  A few weeks ago her husband was casually driving his rickshaw at night time, and due to the darkness his rickshaw collided with the barriers and its body got seriously damaged.  Now the passengers are unable to sit in his rickshaw.
Iqra has requested a loan so that her husband can maintain the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly again.  Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband.
Iqra says thank to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of Rickshaw Body.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es un mujer de 27 años, está casada con Rogelio quien es padre su único hijo de 3 años. Vive en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Nancy se inicio en las actividades agrícolas con ayuda de su esposo y padre de sus hijos desde hace más de 8 años cultivando cacao orgánico siendo su principal fuente de ingreso. Posee una terreno agrícola el cual trabaja con bastante esmero porque lo compro con el fruto de mucho esfuerzo como trabajadora en distintos cultivos. En sus terrenos podemos hallar plantaciones de cacao orgánico y barbasco los cuales vende a los acopiadores zonales por ser productos  con mucha demanda.
Para desempeñar las tareas complicadas contrata a trabajadores del lugar logrando recuperar su inversión a fin de campaña. Al tener mucho objetivos a largo plazo espera trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para ahorra y poner una tienda de comestibles en el primer piso de su vivienda para obtener ganancias adicionales paralelo a su trabajo en el campo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, she is married to Rogelio, and they have a son who is 3 years old.  She lives in her own house that is made from adobe.  Nancy has worked in agriculture with her husband for more than 8 years growing organic cocoa, and this is her main source of income.  

She owns a parcel of land that she works on very carefully because she bought it with hard-earned money.  On her land we can find organic cocoa crops and mullein (plants commonly used in herbal medicine) that she sells to collectors in the region, as herbal medicine products are now in high demand.

She hires workers to perform the most complicated tasks on her land, and she recovers the cost of the workers at the end of the season.

She has many goals, the biggest of which is to save money so that she can open a small grocery store on the first floor of her home in order to earn additional income in parallel with her work on the land.  

This is her second loan from Kiva and she is thankful for the financial support that she is receiving so that she can get by.  She also promises to make payments punctually.  With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra de 51 años, es cliente recurrente en la Fundación Campo desde el año 1995, es una de las personas fundadoras de la institución, es miembro activa del comité de crédito que esta en la comunidad donde reside; madre de 9 hijos,  los cuales, cuatro emigraron hacia los Estados Unidos por necesidad de llevar una vida mas digna, ella se caso a los 24 años.  Trabaja junto con su esposo, hasta el día de hoy en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo).

Ella estudio hasta 4º grado en su comunidad, procede de una familia de 4 hermanos (tres varones y una hembra) sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar fuertemente para salir adelante.
En su casa vive con su esposo y 5 de sus 9 hijos, tres estudian en la comunidad la educación básica, una de ella estudia enfermería en la ciudad, y otra esta junto a ella en los quehaceres del hogar y apoyándola en la sastrería.

 En 1996, ella se fue a la ciudad a un taller de sastrería, en el cual aprendió a hacer pantalones y camisas para hombres y mujeres. Esto le ha ayudado pues actualmente hace los uniformes a los estudiantes de seis escuelas de las comunidades aledañas, a dicha actividad le ayuda su hija y tres personas mas.

Hace casi dos años  esta trabajando en las hortalizas (siembra de pepino, tomate, chile, brocoli y otros), este oficio lo ha aprendido gracias a varias capacitaciones y asistencia técnica que esta recibiendo de algunas instituciones que trabajan en la agricultura. Para ello tiene que ir a comprar la semillas a la ciudad mas cercana, el cual le toma cerca de 30 minutos en transporte urbano.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes para la siembra de hortalizas en el cual invertirá $250.00 y también para pagar mano de obra $150.00 algunos fungicidas ella  los elabora en la comunidad, a base de plantas. También, comprara abono para el cultivo de maíz y frijol  $400.00, pagar los obreros $200.
con dicha inversión, espera obtener muy buenas cosechas y asegurar la alimentación para su familia.


La señora Alejandra sueña con instalar un negocio bien organizado en la comunidad, a la vez sus aspiraciones son sacar adelante a sus hijos en el estudio, para ello trabaja todos los días.
texts.en: Alejandra is 51 years old and has been a recurrent client of Fundacion Campo since 1995.  She is one of the founding members of the organization, and is an active member of the loan committee in her community.  She was married at age 24 and has 9 children; four of her children have emigrated to the United States out of the need for a better life.  She works together with her husband in agriculture (growing corn, beans and sorghum).  She completed the fourth grade in her community.  She comes from a family of 4 siblings (three males and one female), whose parents always taught them to work hard in order to get ahead.  She lives in her house wth her husband and 5 of her 9 children. Three of her children are students at the basic education level in their community, one is studying nursing in the city, and the other helps her with the household work and in her tailor shop. In 1996 she went to a clothing factory in the city, where she learned to make pants and shirts for men and women.  This helped her, so that she now makes uniforms for the students in six schools in neighboring communities.  Her daughter and three other people help her with this activity.  For almost two years she has worked growing vegetables (planting cucumbers, tomatoes, chilies, broccoli and other things).  She learned this trade through training and technical assistance that she has received through various organizations that work in agriculture. For this activity she needs to travel to the closest city to buy seeds, which takes about 30 minutes by urban transport.  The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer to grow the vegetables, which will cost $250.00, and to pay $150.00 for laborers.  She makes some plant-based fungicides herself in the community. She will also buy manure to grow corn and beans for $400.00, and pay the laborers $200.00. With this investment she will obtain better harvests and ensure that her family is fed.  Alejandra dreams of setting up a well-organized business in her community.  Her aspiration is also to support her children in their studies. It is for them that she works every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow vegetables for $250.00, and also to pay the laborers $150.00.  She will also buy manure to grow corn and beans for $400.00, and pay the laborers $200.00.

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA AMISTAD”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Brigida es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de mochilas, venta de pescado, venta de verduras, artesanía en awayos, tienda de abarrotes, venta de medias, costura de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Brigida es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación sus amigas que son socias de la institución y le comentaron de la forma de trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas a macramé; este negocio lo inicio hace quince años atrás, aprendiendo de la ayuda que realizaba a su madre en el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su negocio (compra de puesto de venta) que adquirirá en una feria zonal de la ciudad de El Alto, para poder instalarse y no deambular en varios lugares. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Amistad" (New Friendship) will begin its sixth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Pan American Focus Point. It is made up of eight members and directed by a Board of Directors of which Brigida is the secretary. The businesses that the communal bank's members are moving forward are varied. Among them are: backpack sewing, fish sales, vegetables sales, crafting of Awayos (traditional Bolivian weavings), a grocery store, sock sales, and sportswear sewing.

The loan they will take out will benefit small scale micro-entrepreneurs, one of which is Brigida. She says that two years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of her friends who are partners of the institution and who told her about the type of work that they were doing there. Currently, she has a weaving business and sells macrame blankets. She started this business five years ago, learning from the help she gave her mother in the same business.

The loan she will take out is for the expansion of her business. She will buy a sales stall that she will acquire at a regional fair in the city of El Alto, in order to be able to settle into a location and not have to walk around to different places. This type of work permits her to generate resources for her family since she is married and has five children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy a sales stall

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is a young Cameroonian woman who is married with an 8-month-old child.  She has been in this business (selling animal feed) for over a year now, which makes her experienced and stable.  Her experience and the number of customers she has make her successful in this business.  She is likely to succeed because her business is located in an urban area where the main occupation of people living there is animal husbandry.  Also, she is into wholesale so many retailers in rural areas buy from her.  This loan will help her increase her turnover from 450,000 XAF to 550,000 XAF.  This will increase her business as well as her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for animal feed

loans.name: Mukokoma Mixed Group

texts.en: Harriet is a married woman with four children.  She is thankful to the Kiva lenders for how far they have brought her, along with other group members.  She operates a small retail shop in a busy trading centre.  She has been able to meet the basic needs of her family with this shop.  She supplements the meager resources with income from agriculture.  She is hard-working and is confident in the growing partnership with her other group members.  She will use the loan to buy retail stock to sell.

loans.use: to restock the retail shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Teshie city, which is in the greater Accra region.  Sarah is married and she has two school-aged sons.  Her husband works as a building contractor.  Sarah has been engaged in selling yams, roasted chicken, and turkey tails for eight years.  At first she worked from her house.  After saving some money and gaining a lot of loyal customers, she decided to build a wooden structure for her business.  Sarah buys and sells yams, roasted chicken, and turkey tails that she procures from the wholesale market.  Sarah has asked for a loan of GHS 1,500 to buy more product for sale.  She hopes very much that this loan will bring more income to her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell yams, roasted chicken, and turkey tails, which she procures from the wholesale market.

loans.name: Abarihamwe Group-Kyeera

texts.en: Denis, a married man with five children, found a need for entertainment in his village and seized the opportunity to start a video hall. He works all the days of the week to maximise profits from his video hall. He operates in an area with no electricity, and his challenge has been the expense of the generator, which keeps breaking down affecting service delivery to his customers. He thanks UGAFODE for coming to his rescue and that of other group members. He believes this loan will take them to new milestones. His service delivery, in particular, will increase and so will his income as a result of the new generator he will buy using the loan money. He is hardworking and social.

loans.use: To buy a television set and generator for his video hall

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 52-year-old married woman.  She is taking loan for her daughter’s beauty salon.  Her daughter is unmarried and taking an active part to increase the family's monthly income.  Her daughter is fully professional in her arts.  She provides makeover services to her clients at home.  Most of her clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her arts.  With the passage of time her beauty products are going to run out and at this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon.  Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her daughter would be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.  She wants to establish a beauty parlor in a nearby town because she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  Abida feels proud to see her daughter’s profession and is very inspired by her arts.  Abida says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products for her daughter's beauty salon.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a 35-year-old married woman.  She has 4 children aged between 1 and 12 years old.  She describes herself as determined.  She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair treatments, hair plaiting, and other beauty services.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to expand her business.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hair braids and other beauty salon items.  Her business goal is to become a wholesaler of cosmetics within 5 years.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and other beauty salon items

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Couturière depuis 1995 à Lomé, Ablavi manque de machines pour répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle sollicite le premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre cet objectif. Mariée, elle à 03 enfants en charge tous scolarisés. Elle souhaite agrandir son secteur d’activité et subvenir aux besoins des enfants. Ablavi est âgée de 38ans.
texts.en: A dressmaker in Lomé since 1995, Ablavi does not have enough machines to respond to her customers' needs. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to achieve this objective. She is married and has three children in her care, all of whom attend school. She hopes to expand her business and provide for her children. Ablavi is 38 years old.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en:
Gulom is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He is a hardworking man. He has been busy with his business for more than five years. He sells industrial goods. 

Gulom manages his business alone. He makes his deals very well. His wife has her own business. He gets a good profit from his business. From profit, he repaired his house and bought furniture. 

To improve his business, he is borrowing 2,000 Somoni from IMON International organization to buy industrial goods to increase working capital. He’s hopeful about the possibility of expanding his business soon.

loans.use: to buy industrial goods to increase working capital.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Rogelio es un joven de 25 años que vive junto a su esposa Dayna y su pequeño hijo de 2 años en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Desde muy niño siempre fue participe en las diversas actividades que desempeñaban sus padres para sustento de su familia tal como es la producción de cacao orgánico. Rogelio se deica a la agricultura y gracias al apoyo de sus padres y como agradecimiento por su trabajo recibió como parte de una herencia un terreno agrícola de 6 cuadras en donde siembra cacao orgánico por ser uno de los productos más comerciales de la zona. Al inicio le fue díficil obtener ingresos para la inversión en plantas de injerto y la compra de abono orgánico motivándolo a acudir a la  entidad financiera a la que pertenecen sus padres y solicitar también un crédito. Este es su primer crédito y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a 25 year old young man who lives with his wife Dayna and their 2 year old son in their own home constructed of brick. From a very young age,  he was always involved in the various activities that his parents were doing to support the family, such as growing organic cocoa. Rogelio makes his living through agriculture. Thanks to the support of his parents and in gratitude for his hard work, as part of his inheritance of he received a six square block plot of farm land where he grows organic cocoa, which is one of the main crops in the area.  

At first, it was difficult to obtain financing to invest in grafted plants and to buy organic fertilizer, which motivated him to go to the financial institution that his parents belong to and request a loan. This is his first loan and he is grateful for the financial support he is receiving in order to move forward. In addition, he promises to make his payments on time. On this occasion, he wishes to receive 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer and nourish his crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jekawili I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAWILI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme SALIMATA debout en première position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the "Jekawili I" group are married women, on average 42 years old with six children, and all live in polygamous households in Korobarrage, one of the towns in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institute Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their farming activity properly during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Ms. Salimata, standing all the way on the right in the photo, grows maize.
With her loan, she intends to pay for labour, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold in town and in Sikasso after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 100,000 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, agricultural inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 29ans, Akoko coiffeuse de profession vit avec son mari et son enfant de 09ans à Lomé. Après sa formation, elle  ouvre un atelier et emploie 02 personnes pour lui prêter main forte dans l’exécution de son activité. En plus de la coiffure, elle revend des produits de beauté à ses clients. C’est dans cette lignée qu’elle sollicite un premier crédit pour renforcer son stock. Elle espère ouvrir un second salon et bien élevé son enfant avec le profit tiré.
texts.en: A young woman aged 29, Akoko is a hairstylist by profession and lives with her husband and 9-year-old child in Lomé. After her training, she opened a salon, and currently employs two people to lend a hand in the execution of her business. In addition to hairstyling, she sells cosmetics to her customers. It is in this field that she is seeking her first loan to strengthen her stock. She hopes to open a second salon and raise her child well with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jekawili Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAWILI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  MARIAM assise en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the "Jekawili II" group are married women, on average 42 years old with six children, and all live in polygamous households in Korobarrage, one of the towns in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institute Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their farming activity properly during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Ms. Mariam, sitting all the way on the right in the photo, grows maize.
With her loan, she intends to pay for labour, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold in town and in Sikasso after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 90,000 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, agricultural inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Jekawili Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAWILI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  NEMA  assise au milieu  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 80.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the "Jekawili III" group are married women, on average 42 years old with six children, and all live in polygamous households in Korobarrage, one of the towns in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institute Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their farming activity properly during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Ms. Nema, sitting in the middle of the photo, grows maize.
With her loan, she intends to pay for labour, seeds, and fertilizers to maintain 0.5 hectares. The produce is sold in town and in Sikasso after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 80,000 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, agricultural inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. One of her sons is shown in the photo. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. It now requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Rukhsana has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Rukhsana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is a young Cameroonian, aged 29, married with two children. The older is twelve years old and in secondary school while the younger is nine years old and in primary school. She operates a call center and also sells honey jam and boiled eggs in an urban center. She has been in this business for the past two years which makes her very experienced and successful. She is likely to succeed because of the location of her business which is at a junction where many other business   that need communication credits are located. This loan will help her increase her turnover from 400,000 Frs. to 650,000 Frs. monthly. Her profit will increase by 15 percent monthly and her living standards will increase as well.

loans.use: to pay for communication credit, boiled eggs and honey jam

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit and her nice family lives in Ijevan city. She is married and she has two sons and a daughter. All of them are already married and they live separately with their families, only her elder son with his family lives with them. Anahit’s husband is unemployed since he is disabled. Anahit has higher education in pedagogy and for many years she has worked as a teacher of physics. Today she is retired and she runs her own business. She has a shop of her own and she sells great range of products. The variety of the products is so large (bakery, dairy products, sweets, drinks, cans, different household products etc.), that one can find anything in this shop that he wants. The location of the shop is very good and prices are very good for citizens.  Anahit’s son and daughter-in-law help her very much in her business, the income of which is the only and the main source of covering their family needs and expenses.
This is fourth loan with Kiva for Anahit and this time she asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy sugar, flour and other products for her shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other products for her shop in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Zahoor

texts.en:
Zahoor is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field.  Her son assists her by purchasing her stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Zahoor is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and with health care. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of rice, grain and flour to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, grain and flour.

loans.name: Lev

texts.en: Lev is from Jermuk town where he lives with his parents. Since 2008 Lev has been providing hotel services to people who come to have their rest in Jermuk. As Jermuk town is famous for its hot springs and its brand of mineral water, that is bottled in the vicinity, there are a lot of tourists during the year. Therefore Lev's service is highly demanded among people and Lev is able to sustain his family's living. In order to renovate the renting rooms Lev needs financial support for which he has applied for this loan. It is important for him to renovate the rooms and provide better conditions to customers.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of rooms for rent.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 41 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Es comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de tortilla desde hace 14 años. Ella comercializa sus productos en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda economicamente a través del trabajo de barbería que realiza. Tiene como expectativa surtir su negocio, mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y comprar activos fijos donde pueda exhibir sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, maíz, frijol, azúcar, café, pan entre otros. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá adquirir  mayores ingresos y  satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is originally from the city of Boaco. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is a shopkeeper. She has made a living through the sale of groceries and tortillas for 14 years. She sells her products from her home. She counts on the support of her husband, who helps her economically through his work in a barber shop. She has the hope of supplying her business, improving the infrastructure of her home, and purchasing fixed assets where she can display her products.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, corn, beans, sugar, coffee, and bread, among others. She estimates that the loan will help her a lot, since she will be able to acquire a higher income and satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans, sugar, coffee, and bread, among others.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 43-year-old woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for three years now and is proud to be contributing to her household's income. When Yasmeen was not earning her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family so Yasmeen felt obliged to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. She has therefore requested for 30,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in different colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Jawai

texts.en: Jawai, age 41, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is a dedicated mother of five. She needs to improve her business to meet the basic demands of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed her third loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Zahida wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is a 29-year-old, married woman, she has been in the business of animal sales for the past five years with the support of her husband. She has four goats. She purchases animals such as baby goats and after raising them, she sells in the market near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has six children; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase two more goats. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 41 years old and lives with his family in the village of Achajur in Tsvush region. He is married and has a daughter and a son who are school-aged. His wife works at their village school as a teacher of history. 

For many years, Hamlet has worked at the Tavush Regional Administration as the head of the department of Irrigation Systems. Today, he also works at the Administration but in a different department. 

At the same time, Hamlet and his wife manage farming and agriculture. He keeps in his farm ten piglets and thirty chickens. Hamlet has a beautiful fruit and vegetable garden; he has apple, plum, peach, persimmon trees. He also cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, and beans. 

They perfectly manage to sell the harvest of their garden and farm products.
Hamlet wants to enlarge his fruit garden and he asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian Drams to plant more trees and begin the cultivation of cereals.

loans.use: to enlarge his fruit garden, plant more trees, and begin the cultivation of cereals.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a married lady, aged 43, and a mother of two. She is running a small general store where she sells bangles, jewellery items, hair accessories, cosmetic products and more. She has been in the business of selling cosmetics and jewelry for the past three years and has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy more jewellery and beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks and creams in order to improve and enrich the business through the availability of a greater variety of products to meet customer demand. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to expand her business by adding a new product line such as clothing in her existing business.

loans.use: to buy more jewellery and beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks and creams.

loans.name: Amtal

texts.en: Amtal is a 50-year-old, married woman and a mother of four. She has been doing an animal sales and purchase business for the past ten years. She purchases animals such as baby goats, cows and sheep and after raising them, she sells in the market. She makes enough money to have a healthy life through her business. Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Amtal is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Jekawili Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAWILI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme ASSETOU assise en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Jekawili IV Group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old, have six children, and all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, a village in Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region. They work with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming during the rainy season. The group is on their fifth loan with the MFI, and the previous loans have all been properly repaid.

The crop to be grown is corn, by Mrs. Assetou, sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, Mrs. Assetou plans to purchase [enough] labor, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain half [a hectare]. The crop will be sold in the village and in Sikasso after the harvest, to male and female customers. Mrs. Assetou expects to see a profit of 85,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase labor, farm inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 46-year-old woman. She has been running a business of buying and selling animals for many years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 27-year-old, married lady and enjoys doing a work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors. For this she availed her third loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way she will manage to complete the orders of her customers on time which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Iqbal Mai is a 34-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. Two of her daughters also assist her in making the beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Iqbal Mai's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shares her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Muhtor

texts.en: Muhtor is 53 years old. He is a hardworking man. He sells a variety of dried fruits. He stores his merchandise in a local market. He began working this way over fifteen years ago because he needed to earn money. Currently, his wife helps him to manage business. He wants to develop his business and maximize his profit. With this aim he is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy dried fruits to increase his working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Kotognongontala I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KOTOGNONGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  SATOU  assise en deuxième  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Kotognongontala I Group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old, have six children, and all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, a village in Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming during the rainy season. The group is on its fifth loan with the MFI, and the previous loans have been properly repaid.

The crop to be grown is corn, with Mrs. Satou, seated second from the left in the photo. With her loan, Mrs. Satou plans to pay for [enough] labor, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain half [a hectare]. The crop will be sold in the village market after the harvest, to male and female customers.

Mrs. Satou expects to see a profit of 90,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase labor, farm inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Leonor Yanet

texts.es:
Leonor, es una persona trabajadora y su estado civil es viuda, vive en casa propia y tiene una hija de 20 años de edad. Ella, posee una tienda para obtener ingresos y para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años y lo desempeña todos los días por lo que su negocio es propio y lo tiene en su casa. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, golosinas, bebidas, detergentes, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la capacidad de inversión y sus ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, optimizar las condiciones económicas y brindarle el estudio universitario a su hija.
texts.en:
Leonor is a hard working person, and she’s a widow. She lives in her own home with her 20 year old daughter. She has a store so that she can have an income and cover basic needs. She’s been doing this business for 10 years. She works every day since it’s her business and in her home. 

The loan she needs will let her buy basic food products like beans, rice, sugar, salt, oil, candy, drinks, detergents, etc. This loan will help her grow her investment capacity and her income.

Her dream is to improve her business, optimize her financial standing, and provide her daughter with a university education.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, salt, oil, candy, drinks, detergent, etc.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José, es cliente recurrente de la Fundación campo, una persona de 33 años de edad, se caso con su esposa hace 6 años, ahora tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, por quienes trabaja arduamente en la agricultura y darle lo mejor a su familia.
Su esposa trabaja tejiendo hamacas de cascarilla, para ir a vender al pueblo donde residen, ella aprendió el oficio de sus padres quines también se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías de hilo.

Don José, se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijoles) en la comunidad, para ir a los cultivos se levanta a las cinco de la mañana todos los días, tiene que caminar 30 minutos por veredas para llegar donde posee los cultivos, trabaja desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. o según sea la actividad que realiza.
Actualmente siembra dos veces al año maíz y frijoles, maicillo siembra una vez en el año. Durante los meses de abril y agosto. Él aprendió de sus padres quienes lo crecieron en la agricultura, antes trabajoo durante casi dos años en la construcción de una carretera que pasa por la zona donde reside.
Compra los insumos para los cultivos en la ciudad mas cercana, tiene que viajar en bus hasta el destino, lo cual recorre durante 40 minutos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, pago del alquiler de la tierra, ademas comprara material (hilo) para la elaboración de hamacas.

Con ello pretende obtener mejores cosechas en los cultivos, para asegurar la alimentación para su familia. Con la elaboración de hamacas también pretende con su esposa aumentar las ganancias, ambos poseen la experiencia en los trabajos que realizan.


Don José sueña con ir mejorando poco a poco su casa, el crédito que se le otorgo anteriormente hace año y medio hizo su casa de bahareque para la familia, antes vivía en la casa de los suegros. 
También, sueña sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios, pues él no tuvo esa oportunidad cuando era joven.
texts.en:
Jose is a recurring client with La Fundacion Campo. He’s 33 years old and married to his wife of 6 years. He has two children who are 5 and 2 years old. He works very hard for his family, giving them the best. His wife weaves husk hammocks to sell in the town where they live. She learned this craft from her parents who also made handicrafts out of thread. 

Jose works in the agricultural sector (planting corn, sorghum, and beans) in his community. To work his crop, he gets up at 5am every morning. He has to hike 30 minutes to where he has his crops. He works from 6am until 2pm or until his work is done. Right now he plants corn and beans twice a year in April and August, and he plants sorghum once a year. He was taught by his parents who raised him in the agriculture business. Before this work, he worked for two years on the construction of a road that goes through the area where he lives. He buys farming supplies in the nearest city. He has to take a 40 minute bus ride to get there. 

The loan he’s asking for is to buy four bags of manure, pay rent for his land, and later buy material (thread) to make hammocks. He aims to get better crops to ensure that he can feed his family. By making hammocks he also aims to increase income with his wife’s help. They both have experience in the work they do.  

Jose dreams of improving his house little by little. The loan he got a year and a half ago was to build a wattle and duab house for his family since before they lived in their in-laws house. Also, he wants his children to get ahead in their studies since he didn’t have that opportunity when he was young.

loans.use: to buy four bags of manure, pay rent for his land, and also buy material (thread) to make hammocks.

loans.name: Nelson Virgilio

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, esta casado; su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen en común dos hijos una hembra de 17 años un varón de 14 años, los que se encuentran estudiando a nivel básico. Además, viven con él, dos hijos de crianza de 23 y 19 años los cuales se dedican a la albañilería

Él se dedica a comercializar productos lácteos, y al cuido de su ganado desde hace unos 14 años. Antes se dedicada a la agricultura. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  dos vaquillas de repasto. Lo que,  mejorara su vida y su negocio porque producirá mas productos lácteos y ayudara de mejor manera a su familia; la necesidad a satisfacer será la de mejorar la dieta  alimenticia de sus hijos.
Manifiesta que seguirá trabajando mucho, su sueño es ver a su familia, con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor, que sus hijos sean personas trabajadoras, serviciales a esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Nelson is a married man who’s 38 years old and who’s finished the 9th grade. His wife works as a housekeeper. Together they have two children—a 17 year old daughter and a 14 year old son who are both in school. Additionally two foster children live with him. They are 23 and 19 years old and work in a masonry. For 14 years, Nelson has worked selling dairy products and caring for livestock. Previously he worked in the agricultural sector. 

The loan that Nelson is asking for is to buy two milk cows which will improve his life and his business since he will have more milk products and be able to better support his family. He needs to be able to improve his children’s diet. 

He continues to work hard. His dream is to see his family with everything the need for a better life so that his children will be hard working and helpful to society.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 27 years old and married. She has been running a business purchasing, raising and selling animals for many years. She buys baby animals at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life.  She has two goats. She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Artsrun

texts.en:
Artsrun is 21 years old and he is already a successful and clever businessman. He lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region with his father, mother and sister. Artsrun has a rented shop where he sells great range of stationary. Everything in his shop, as you can see in the photo, is sorted so neatly and carefully that it makes you want to buy something. Artsrun sells notebooks, folders, pens, pencils, felt-tip pens, rulers and calculators, children’s books of fairy tales, watercolors and special glues for papers and more in his shop. Artsrun also has a machine for document copying in his shop. Artsrun buys all his products from the companies who make wholesale trade in his city.

Artsrun asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to renew the stock in his shop for the beginning of the school year, since it is the perfect season to make a good income.

loans.use: to renew his shop's stock for the beginning of the school year.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 40-year-old, energetic, married woman. For the last one year, she and her husband have been manufacturing waan, a kind of rope made after drying a plant-like long grass. Waan is a material used in making charpoy which is a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan. She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she has become famous in providing good quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. She is the mother of three children. She wishes to improve her business and has applied for a loan of 10,000 PKR to buy another waan-making machine so that her son can assist her in his free time. She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another waan making machine.

loans.name: Catherine Del Rocío

texts.es: La cliente vive en Machala.  Inició trabajando con sus hermana, quien la integró al equipo de ventas de la línea Avon.  Se dedica a esta actividad durante el fin de semana, debido a que durante la semana trabaja en una panadería por las mañanas.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en el hospital.  Tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela de su barrio.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de artículos de belleza, lociones y perfumes para su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Machala.  She started working with her sister who joined a sales team that promotes Avon products.  She engages in this business on the weekends since she works on the weekdays at a bakery in the mornings.  The borrower is married and her husband works at a hospital.  They have a son who attends a school in their neighborhood.  

The borrower wants to invest her loan in the purchase of beauty products, lotions, and perfumes that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, lotions, and perfumes.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 47-year-old married woman who is running a business selling milk, with the support of her husband. She has one cow, which she uses to get milk to sell to the people of her locality. Yasmeen has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She is also involved in the work of purchasing and selling animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Yasmeen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more calves. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 22-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) where they sell jewelry and cosmetic items. Her husband also assists her by purchasing the stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Shumaila is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy more jewelry and beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks and creams in order to improve and enrich the business through the availability of more variety of products to meet customer demand. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and beauty products such as make-up, lipsticks and creams.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet is 52 years old and lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has a daughter who is already married and lives separately, and a son who is a student of Yerevan State Medical University. Hamlet has a higher education and has a specialty of engineer. For many years he has worked in his specialty, but now he runs his own business. He has a small shop, where he sells flowers (flower bouquets) and wreaths. Hamlet mentions that his business is a very profitable one and he is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of flowers for the enlargement of his shop assortment and his income from the sale of them as well.

loans.use: To buy a lot of flowers for the enlargement of his shop assortment

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшеду 19 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он успешно учился в средней школе. Чамшед активно участвовал во всех мероприятиях школы. Он в этом году поступил на 1 курс Коммерческого Университета Таджикистана в факультет Налоговое дело. Его родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Чамшед запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jamshed is 19 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. He studied well at high school, and participated actively in all social events at the school. 

This year Jamshed started the first year of studies at the Tajik University of Commerce, at the faculty of Tax. His parents are ordinary workers and are not in a situation where they can pay for their son's tuition. Jamshed requests a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат женщина с прекрасными мыслями и прекрасной душой. Её 53 года. Она разведена, так как ее любимый муж бросил ее. После развода с мужем ей было очень трудно жить и обеспечить себя и свою дочь. Адолат образованная женщина и имеет тонкий вкус. Она работает костюмером в танцевальной группе. Адолат любит свою работу и старается выполнять свою должность на высшем уровне. Данное время она живет с дочерью и двумя внучками. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свою квартиру, так как ее квартира имеет плохое состояние. Адолат должна отремонтировать все комнаты. Она не имеет денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы как краски, обои, алибастер и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Adolat is a woman with great ideas and a beautiful soul. She is 53 years old. She is divorced, as her beloved husband left her. After the divorce it was very hard for her to live and support herself and her daughter. Adolat is an educated woman and she has good taste. She works as a costume designer for a dance group. Adolat loves her work and tries to carry out her work at the highest standard. 

Currently Adolat lives with her daughter and two grandchildren. She has for planned to renovate her apartment for some years already, as it is in a bad condition. Adolat should renovate all rooms. She does not have the money to purchase building materials such as paint, wallpaper, alabaster and similar. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy paint, wall-paper, alabaster etc, for repairing her apartment

loans.name: Rakhshanda's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 29 years old and is representing herself by raising her hand.

She has taken responsibility for all of her group members. Her group consists of 5 members; some members are new and a few are old ones. All of the members have taken a loan according to their needs.

The featured borrower, Rukhsana, took a loan for her husband’s business. In fact her husband owns a computer composing and designing shop. He uses a computer for composing and designing. A few days ago his computer’s motherboard was blown due to a fluctuation in electricity. He saved most of the composing backup data on the hard drive but he is unable to continue his work without a motherboard. Her husband’s business is not profitable and their savings are not enough to buy a new motherboard.

Rukhsana is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school daily. Her husband has to pay for the educational expenses and those of the household as well by himself. His monthly income based upon his single source of income, due to the problem with the computer affects all household expenses and is disturbing. 

Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy a new motherboard to continue his composing business. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a motherboard for a computer for composing and designing.

loans.name: Silvia Adriana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar vive la señora Silvia, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña Silvia es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante y para darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Hace poco ella trabajaba en un almacén de venta de electrodomésticos en la ciudad pero se quedo sin trabajo, es por eso que ella quiere poner un negocio de venta de comida, como ella conoce muchas personas quiere preparar los alimentos y entregar en su antiguo trabajo y en otros almacenes y locales comerciales de la ciudad. 

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar víveres para empezar con su negocio esperando que le vaya bien por el bienestar propio y el su familia.  Lleva dos ciclos en el banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos además de ser rápidos son de mucha ayuda. 

Sus sueños son que le vaya bien en su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Mi Mundo Natural" (My Natural World) meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, known as "La Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos" (City of the Royal Tamarinds) since colonial times. Silvia, 26, lives here, and has a common law husband with whom she has two children, ages six and two. The oldest studies in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Silvia is a fighter. She has always liked to work to get ahead and give the best to her children. She was working recently at a store in the city selling appliances, but she lost her job and for this reason she wants to start a food selling business. Since she knows many people, she wants to prepare their food and deliver it to her former workplace and other stores and commercial areas in the city.

She is going to use the loan to buy food to start her business, hoping that it goes well for her, for the sake of her own well-being and that of her family. She has been with the communal bank for two loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans are quick and very helpful.

Her dream is for her business to go well, and to give her small children what is best for them.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: San Pablo De Chauca Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN PABLO DE CHAUCA” está conformada por 08 socios quienes  se encuentran  pasando el 02 ciclo.
