Maria se dedica a la siembra y venta de chirimoya, palta y manzana y a la vez trabaja en los trabajos comunales que organiza la municipalidad de la zona en donde vive. Su mayor deseo es implementar  una bodega con los productos de primera necesidad. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el préstamo brindado. Maria es la tercera del lado derecho viste chaleco azul y de la misma manera se encuentra la foto de Sheyla en la parte superior derecho que no puedo estar presente en la reunión.
texts.en:
The “Saint Paul of Chauca Group” is composed of 8 members who are now in their 2nd loan cycle. Maria is a farmer and sells custard apples, avocados, and apples, and at the same time, she works in communal efforts organized by the municipality in the zone where she lives. 

Maria's greatest desire is to launch a general store selling products of primary necessity. The loan will be invested in purchasing fertilizers.

The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the offered loan. Maria is the 3rd person on the right wearing a blue jacket and, at the same time, Sheyla, who could not be present at the meeting, appears in the photo on the upper right.

loans.use: to buy compost for their fields.

loans.name: Evelia Georgete

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar vive la señora Evelia, tiene 64 años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa.

Doña Evelia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella desde hace 15 años se dedica a preparar comida para vender, como no tiene un local ella entrega almuerzos y en ciertas ocasiones meriendas a domicilio, tiene clientes en ciertas instituciones a los cueles día a día les envía sus deliciosos platos los mismos que cobra por quincena, razón por lo cual necesita de los créditos ya que hasta que ella pueda cobrar tiene que comprar los productos para preparar los alimentos. Ella quiere con este crédito arreglar un local para instalar un restaurante el cual es su sueño.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres, mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para poner su restaurante. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del Banco.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mi Mundo Natural” (My Natural World) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which is known as the “City of the Royal Tamarind Trees”.  Sra. Evelia lives in this place.  She is 64 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four grown children.  One child still lives at home.  

Doña Evelia is a very determined woman who enjoys working so that she can get ahead.  She has been preparing food to sell for the past 15 years.  Since she does not have a shop, Evelia delivers lunches and occasional snacks from her home.  She has customers at certain institutions where she sends her delicious dishes and then collects payment every two weeks.  For this reason, she needs the loans so that she can buy the products she uses for preparing her dishes until she is able to collect payment.  Evelia wants to use this loan to remodel a space where she can set up a restaurant, which has been her dream.  

This loan will also be used to buy ingredients, tables, chairs, and cooking utensils for her restaurant.  Evelia has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the assistance that she has received from the Bank.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, tables, chairs, and cooking utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five; three of them are in school. Her husband’s sloe income is not enough to meet all household expenses, so Bushra started her own work of tailoring at home three years ago. 

She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, elastics, and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, elastics, and buttons.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 36-year-old lady from Kakamega, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports 5 people in her family.  She is a single mother of 5 kids who are 13, 11, 9, 7 and 4 years old respectively.

She sells green groceries, a business she has been doing for the last 6 years, and gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase the volume of her stock. She will use the anticipated income to expand the business and start a new business.

Her dream is to open an early childhood center for education.

loans.use: to increase the volume of her stock

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education.

She, with her husband, has been doing agricultural work for many years. She plants different flowers and then sells them to the people of her locality and in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase stock of different types of seeds for planting roses, Kangi palm and red palm, Perveen applied a loan of 50,000 PKR. This would help her to grow different types, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase stock of different types of seeds for planting roses, Kangi palm and red palm

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Момагул жительница предгорного района Хамадони. Она 50-летняя замужняя женщина с шестью детьми. У нее трое дочерей и трое сыновей, всем детям больше 18 лет. Два ее сына и одна дочь находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Один сын работает мастером строителем. Муж Момагул пенсионер. Сама Момагул домохозяйка. Сейчас Момагул решила открыть бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить пару голов крупнорогатого скота и приступить к деятельности. Для выращивания и содержания скота у нее есть все условия. И к тому же сам климат района благоприятствует здесь ведению данного вида деятельности.
texts.en:
Momagul is a resident of the foothill region Hamadoni. She is a 50 years old and married woman with six children. She has three daughters and three sons, and all are older than 18 years. Two of her sons and one daughter are migrant workers in foreign countries. One son works as a master builder. Momagul's husband is retired, and she is a housewife. 

Now Momagul has decided to start a business of animal sales. She requests a loan in order to purchase two heads of cattle and launch the business. She has good conditions for breeding cattle. Even the climate in the region is favorable for conducting this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle in order to start an animal sales business

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es:
Paula Emilia 57 años de edad casada con seis hijos mayores de edad, originaria de una de las comarcas de Chinandega ubicada en norte del occidente del país ella se dedica a la venta de  hielo, refrescos naturales como: Chilla, Pitaya, granadia, pozol con leche, remolachas, ensaladas de frutas  entre otros, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en el municipio de Chinandega el cual es fijo, ella lucha día a día para poder llevar el sustento a su familia, ella está muy contenta con lo que hace ya que es lo que la ha sacado adelante a ella y a sus hijos. El objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como frutas naturales para la realización de estos deliciosos refrescos naturales

p
texts.en:
Paula Emilia, 57, is married and has six adult children. She is originally from the region of Chinandega, located in the northwest of the country. She makes a living selling ice, natural beverages such as: Chilla (a drink made with chia seeds), Pitaya (a cactus fruit based drink), passion fruit drinks, pozol con leche (a corn-based drink with milk), beet juice, fruit salad, and more. Her business is in a fixed location in the municipality of Chinandega.

She fights day-to-day to be able to support her family. She is very happy with what she does since it is what has gotten her and her children ahead. The goal of this loan is to buy ingredients such as natural fruit in order to make these delicious natural beverages.

loans.use: to buy various fruit ingredients for the preparation of the delicious natural beverages that she makes

loans.name: Rosa Digna

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa, tiene 61 años de edad,  es soltera, reside junto a su hijo y dos nietas en una comunidad del Municipio de Puerto Cortes.
Doña Rosa se ha dedicado siempre al comercio y a las labores del hogar, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, ahora ha surtido de productos de la canasta básica familiar también. El negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace mas de cuatro años, dedicándole el tiempo necesario. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo que es el cuarto ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de más productos como refrescos, granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, condimentos, sal, frutas y verduras. 
Su meta es continuar con su negocio, invertir sus ganancias para hacerlo crecer y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 61, is single.  She lives with her son and two grandchildren in a community in the Puerto Cortes municipality.

Rosa has always worked in commerce, and she has always done the household chores.  She started selling fruits and vegetables.  She has now stocked up on basic products as well.  She has had the business in her house for over four years, and she devotes the necessary time to it.

She has decided to request another loan, which is her fourth cycle, for 13,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock more products like soft drinks, basic grains, sugar, shortening, condiments, salt, fruit, and vegetables.

Her goal is to continue with her business, to invest her profits in order to make it grow, and to help her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with soft drinks, basic grains, sugar, shortening, condiments, salt, fruit, and vegetables.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр молодой и целеустремленный человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Бахтиёр в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он с детства мечтал получать высшее образование и служить своей Родине. В школе он учился хорошо и отлично. Бахтиёр живет с матерью и братьями. Бахтиёр должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4300 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a young and purposeful man. He is 18 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Bahtiyor successfully finished high school this year, and started at the university. Since childhood he dreamed of getting higher education and serving his homeland. At school he studied hard and well. 

Bahtiyor lives with his mother and brothers. He should pay for his tuition, but does not have the money. He requests a loan in the amount of 4,300 somoni to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay his tuition

loans.name: Farnaz

texts.en:
Farnaz is a 26-year-old married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for four years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income.

When Farnaz was not earning, her family was going through sever financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Farnaz felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PKR and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 46-year-old married woman and mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Mukhtaran’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Mukhtaran has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Mukhtaran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is a 49-year-old married man. He lives in Zugdidi district with his wife and three children. His wife is a housekeeper and his children go to school. Each member of his family is provided a monthly pension from the government institutions for being refugees.

The only other source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Merab working as a welder locally. He has welding equipment and welds cars. He has decided to expand his welding business to supplement his income but he does not qualify under the income requirements. Merab is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. Merab will use his loan to purchase new welding equipment that is more modern and powerful. He will have more customers and provide services to his local community members. He hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase welding equipment

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 32 years old and married. He is from the village of Giorgeti. He lives with his wife and two school-age children. His family runs an agricultural business and cultivates a plot of land where potatoes and red beans are grown. In addition,  Levan runs a small dairy farm with two milk cows and produces cheese to sell.

Levan is a very energetic and hardworking young man and wishes to provide his family with enough income. That’s why he decided to start a trading business. With this start-up loan, Levan plans to purchase a van to use to make fruit and vegetable deliveries. He will sell the fresh produce in the neighboring villages and have a stable income, which will enable him to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Levan will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a van to sell fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбаре 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гулбары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулбара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулбары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 4 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,15 ГА, на которой ежегодно выращивает: фасоль, болгарский перец, клевер, картошку, капусту. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Гулбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 50 years old, married and is raising three children together with her husband. Gulbara has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Gulbara works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 28 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulbara's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, one calf, four horses and she also has a plot of land of 2.15 hectares. Every year she grows beans, bell peppers, clover, potatoes and cabbage on this land. The monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulbara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of nitrate to work the land. Gulbara plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock and plans to save money to purchase furniture.

loans.use: to purchase nitrate

loans.name: Arnold

texts.es:
Arnold, tiene 40 años de edad, casado con tres hijos, vive en una comunidad de Santa Bárbara.
el siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero hace 15 años que se dedica al cultivo propio de café, hace sus viveros luego los siembra,  cuenta con dos manzanas cultivadas, mas otros terrenos que fueron heredados por su padre, siembra variedad de producto. Lo vende en pergamino húmedo y seco en el mercado local. Su familia también se dedica a esta actividad. Esta solicitando otro préstamo el cual es el cuarto ciclo y es por 7,000 Lempiras. Este préstamo lo invertirá en darle mantenimiento de limpieza y fertilización al cultivo de café. Su meta es mejorar la plantación y la cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Arnold, age 40, is married and has three children.  He lives in a community in Santa Barbara.

He has always worked in agriculture.  However, he has worked with his own coffee crops for 15 years.  He makes his nursery, and then he plants them.  He has two cultivated ‘manzanas’ [plots of land].  He has other land that he inherited from his father.  He plants a variety of products.  He sells wet parchment and dried at the local market.  His family also works at this business activity.

He is requesting another loan, which is his fourth cycle, for 7,000 lempiras.  He will use this loan for maintenance, clearing the fields, and to fertilize his coffee crop.  His goal is to improve his plants and his coffee harvest.

loans.use: to provide maintenance, to clear the fields, and to fertilize his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is 54 years old, widowed, and from the village of Lashe. She lives with her grown son and daughter-in-law. Her family runs an agricultural business and breeds three milk cows, two pigs, and twenty bee-hives with bee colonies. Nazi produces cheese with the received milk for selling. 

The family members also sell honey from their house. Nazi is a very hardworking woman and wishes to provide her family with the enough income. That’s why she decided to start a trading business. With this start-up loan, Nazi plans to purchase a van and have her son use it for making fruit and vegetable deliveries. 

They will sell the fresh produce in the neighboring villages and have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. With the support of the Start-Up program, Nazi will have an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a van to trade fruits & vegetables.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is 37 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is married and he lives with his retired mother, wife and two children. Gegham works as a coffee distributor. He has a large assortment of coffee that he delivers to nearly 200 shops in the Lori region. He has a small truck of his own and, as he mentions, all day long he drives to different places and works till late at night. 

Gegham has some new plans. Together with coffee, he wants to deliver some sweets (candies, cakes). So he is asking for a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to buy an assortment of sweets and try this new business along with his current one.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of sweets to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida, age 34, is a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Her husband is working in a grocery firm on daily wages. She started sewing clothes after her marriage because from the beginning her husband’s occupation was very poor.

She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She also deals in the business of clothes sales to generate an extra amount of income. To help her continue the operation of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to pay for personal expenses. Khalida is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es: Ileana María reside en departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país tiene 50 años de edad, casada con tres hijos que aun estan bajo su proteccion, ella es propietaria de un negocio de deliciosas reposterías como: pasteles de piña, carne, queso, churros, maletas, crosan, empanadas, queques, prisioneros entre otros,  las cuales son elaboradas por ella. Inicio este negocio buscando un medio de subsistencia, y poniendo en práctica sus conocimientos adquiridos en otras panaderías ella decide poner en marcha su propio negocio, uno de sus sueños es poner un local en el centro del departamento donde habita para poder tener mejores ingresos, ella solicita crédito para la compra de activo fijo cocina industrial  el cual le servirá de mucha ayuda en la elaboración de sus reposterías.-.
texts.en:
Ileana María lives in Chinandega in the western part of the country. She is 50 years old and married with three children who are still under her care. She owns a business of delicious pastries such as pineapple cakes, meat & cheese pastries, maletas (meat pie made with pork, chiles & onion) churros (fried dough covered in sugar),  croissants, empanadas (pastry filled with meat & vegetables), pies, cakes, prisioneros (pastry sometimes made with pineapple) and others, which she makes herself. 

She started this business as a way to make a living, and putting into practice the knowledge she acquired in other bakeries, she decided to start her own business. One of her dreams is to put a store in the center of the department of Chinandega where she lives in order to have better income. She is applying for this loan in order to the purchase an industrial kitchen which will be very helpful in making her pastries. The commercial kitchen will be a fixed asset for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a commercial kitchen to make delicious pastries and desserts

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi appreciates the previous loan she got from Kiva that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KSH 10,000 to purchase palm leaves for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves to weave mats

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсаре 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гулсары - высшее педагогическое образование, работает в сельской школе учителем русского языка, супруг тоже преподаватель. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гулсара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова,4 бычка, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,20 ГА, на которой ежегодно выращивает: перец, фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на стройку дома.
texts.en:
Gulsara is 50 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Gulsara has higher pedagogical education, and works at the village school as a Russian language teacher. Her husband is also a teacher. 

As an additional income for her family, Gulsara works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulsara's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, four bulls and also a plot of land of 2.20 hectares. Here she grows peppers, beans and clover every year. The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulsara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the number of livestock through purchasing two heads of cattle. Gulsara plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and to save money for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and flour for his business.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is from Eghegnadzor, Armenia, where he lives with his parents and his wife. His parents receive retirement pension money and Artak has been providing cargo transportation to locals for 2 years. He transports products to neighboring villages and earns his and his family's living. 
Now, the truck Artak drives is too old and needs to be renovated. As Artak has no financial resources for doing that, he has applied for this loan. The loan is very important to Artak so he can continue his business and sustain his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his truck

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un joven de 23 años, está casada y vive junto a su esposa en su casa construida a base de adobe. Juan se dedica a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en el terreno que sus padres le heredaron hace más de 3 años. Se considera un joven muy trabajador ya que se encuentra en una edad  adecuada para empezar con estas labores agrícolas. Fue así que sus padres decidieron cederle los terrenos que posee actualmente con el objetivo de tener una independencia económica. Considera que el cacao orgánico es una buena fuente de inversión siempre y cuando se aplique un trabajo adecuado por tratarse de una planta algo delicada teniendo que realizar tareas como retiro de maleza, aplicación de abono orgánico y entre otros. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juan is a 23 year old young man.  He's married and lives with his wife in an adobe home.  Juan raises organic cacao and coffee on the land that his parents gave him more than three years ago.  He is considered to be a very hardworking young man since he is at the right age to begin farm work.  This is why his parents decided to give him the land he has so he can be financially independent.

He feels that organic cacao is a good investment whenever the right work is done, such as weeding, adding compost, and other things.  This will be his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support so he can gat ahead and promises to make his payments on time.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy compost to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru: Зебониссо из города Вахдат, ей 41 год. Она верная жена и мать двоих детей. У Зебониссо есть талант в области кройки и шитья женской одежды и узких стёганых одеял (курпача). Далось ей этот талант нелегко, она училась у лучших мастеров своего города. Теперь она уже 20 лет как сама шьет и кроит. Она ведет свою деятельность у себя дома. В ее деле ей больше нравится восторженные лица клиентов для которых она так старается. В данный момент она нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить ткани и новую компьютерную швейную машинку, без этих средств Зебониссо не сможет продолжить свое любимое дело. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Zebonisso is from the city of Vahdat. She is 41 years old. She is a faithful wife and the mother of two children. Zebonisso has a talent for cutting and sewing women's clothing and quilts (kurpacha). She was not easily given this talent, she studied with a good master in her village. 

Currently Zebonissa has sewn by herself for more than 20 years. Her business is in her own home. In her work, she likes enthusiastic clients more, as she works so hard for them. Currently she needs a loan in order to purchase fabric and a new digital sewing machine. Without these means Zebonisso will not be able to continue her beloved business. She hopes very much for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a digital sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is a hardworking woman who operates a kiosk shop. She plans to open a wholesale shop in future.

She is requesting 10,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) to purchase soft drinks, bread, bananas, and sugar for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, bananas, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos con su esposo, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella trabajo por varios años en una maquiladora y luego que quedo sin empleo decidió establecer una pulpería donde vende embutidos, refrescos, golosinas y otros. El negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace dos años y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de mas producto como ser granos básicos, refrescos, churros, dulces, agua en bolsa, pan, dulces etc. su propósito es aumentar las ventas. Ella tiene planes de poder ampliar su casa para acomodad mejor su negocio y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en: Martha is 32 years old, married and has three children with her husband. She lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. She worked for several years in a factory and then after a period of unemployment, she decided to establish a grocery store where she sells sausages, soft drinks, candy and other products. The business is located in her home for the past two years. She decided to apply for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to stock more products such as basic grains, soft drinks, churros (fried dough topped with sugar), candy, bagged water, bread, sweets etc. Her goal is to increase sales. She has plans to expand her home to better accommodate her business and help her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic grains, bread, water, sausages, soft drinks, candy etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 53 years old. She is a widow with two children. She lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. Dolores is a farmer and grows pigs for a living. She has been in this business for six years, earning a monthly income of 3,600. 

Dolores has requested a new loan to purchase feeds for her hogs. Dolores is a member of Paglaum MPC since 2001.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of feeds and other maintenance for her hogs.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Kapan City with her three children. She became a widow very early and, for many years since her children were still small till now, she has worked very hard to support her children with good living conditions. Today, they are already married and live separately with their families. Now Svetlana lives alone, and she has her own small business – she sells flowers. She buys flowers for sale nearly every day from the wholesale market for flowers, which opens very early in the morning and closes very early. Svetlana hurries every morning in order to buy colorful, fresh and beautiful flowers for sale.

Svetlana asks for a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams. She hopes very much the loan will help her to enlarge the assortment of her flowers with new, a little bit expensive flowers, which she was not able to buy before.

loans.use: to enlarge the assortment of her flowers with new, a little bit expensive flowers, which she was not able to buy before

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old. He is married with four children aged between one and eleven. He has been a rice farmer for the past 19 years. He has requested a loan to buy more fertilisers to use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilisers to use during rice production.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 43 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been a rice farmer for twelve years. With this loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy arts and crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks to expand her sales.

loans.name: Manzurakhon

texts.ru: Манзурахон заботливая мать 4 детей. Она вдова и воспитывает детей сама. Трое из детей совершеннолетние, а один еще не совершеннолетний. Манзурахон более 5 лет работает в мобильной компании в должности оператора. Манзурахон является основной кормилицей своей семьи и старается, чтобы ее дети жили в достатке. Манзурахон хочет купить телевизор и кондиционер для своего дома, так как она не имеет телевизора и ее детям скучно без телевизора. Они хотят смотреть новости и быть информированными. Летом погода очень жаркая и они нуждаются в кондиционере. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки кондиционера и телевизора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Manzurakhon is the caring mother of four children. She is a widow so she raises the children herself. Three of the children are adults, and one is still not adult. Manzurakhon has worked at a mobile phone company as an operator for more than five years. 

Manzurakhon is the only breadwinner in her family, and strives for her children to live in abundance. Manzurakhon would like to purchase a TV set and air conditioning for her house, as she does not have a TV and her children are bored without it. She would like to watch the news and be informed. In the summer the weather is very warm and they need air conditioning.

Manzurakhon requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar for the purchase of air conditioning and a TV set. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioning and a TV set for her household

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 44 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have eight children. He has been a rice farmer for the past fifteen years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilisers to use in rice production. The profits from the rice produce will be used to pay for his children’s school fees. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilisers to use during rice production.

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar is 47 years old. She is a widow and lives with her two children, who are students, in Kapan city. Her children are very industrious. In addition to their schooling, they also work and support their mother greatly. Tsovinar is a commodity specialist and this helps her to perfectly manage both of her businesses, clothing and food trading. She has a rented a shop where she simultaneously holds two occupations; she sells men's, women's and children's sportswear, jackets and blouses and she also sells a great range of foods such as dairy products, sweets, canned foods, etc. She mentioned that her shop is very popular in their city with its low prices and great assortment of items.
Tsovinar asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to increase the assortment of items in her shop and increase the income of her family as well.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of items in her shop

loans.name: Jabra Group

texts.en:
This group, called Jabra, is made up of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They got together with the idea of helping their families. Jabra is one of the members. She is 35 years old. She is a married woman and has six children. She says that she puts a lot of effort into helping her family. 

Jabra has a business of selling different types of traditional cosmetic materials. She is facing challenges in her business, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 Yemen Rial (YER) from AMB to buy additional types of cosmetics. 

She wants to be well-stocked so that she can offer a good variety of products to her customers. She will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional types of cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Primavera 27 De Mayo 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA 27 DE MAYO 2”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanessa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido de  chompas, venta de comida, venta de gorras de bebe, tejido de camas y awayos, taller de costura, trenzado de mantas, venta de leche y queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanessa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía de mantas; este negocio lo aprendió de su madre cuando realizaba el apoyo en su taller, posteriormente decide invertir un pequeño capital en la elaboración de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lanas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para seguir estudiando ya que ella aún vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “PRIMAVERA 27 DE MAYO 2" communal bank is in its second cycle within Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada center.  It's made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Vanessa serves as the secretary.  The other members have different businesses such as a neighborhood stores, knitting sweaters, sewing shops, blanket making, milk and cheese sales.

The loan will benefit the small businesses, including Vanessa's.  She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined after being invited by a friend who is also part of the group.  She has a blanket arts and crafts business and learned this from her mother when she helped her in her workshop.  She later decided to invest a little money in the manufacture of these products.

She will use the money from this loan to buy yarn from large suppliers in the city of El Alto and then resell it.  This will allow her to generate income so she can continue studying because she still lives with her mother.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and loans.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 49-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 23 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps chicken. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in an area favorable for businesses and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, manure, feeds, and other items to boost business. Her business goal is to be a regional supplier of farm products within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, manure, feeds, and other items to boost business.

loans.name: Elvis Humberto

texts.es:
Elvis, es una persona trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposa y disfruta de dos hijos. El, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace ocho años, su esposa le ayuda a vender en la casa y sale a vender a otros pueblos.
El préstamo le permitirá comprar variedad de medicina. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir y cubrir la demanda de la clientela, asimismo obtendrá mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es que su negocio sea auto sostenible y no trabajar con créditos sino con capital propio.
texts.en:
Elvis is a hardworking person who lives with his wife; they have two children.  He sells medications and has done this for eight years.  His wife helps sell from the home and also goes out to sell in other towns.

He will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of medications so he can cover his customer demand and thus increase his sales.  His dream is for his business to become self sustaining so that he can operate with his own capital and not need loans.

loans.use: to buy medications.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 48 years old and from a small village of Ambrolauri district. He lives with his retired parents and sister. Amiran works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and haricot. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

He also has a milking cow and sells dairy products locally. As the family has only seasonal income, Amiran decided to start dairy farming and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,100 GEL. 

With the received credit, he will be able to purchase two milking cows. As the additional cows are purchased, he will be able to expand the number of cattle and produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. The new business initiative will give Amiran a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is aged 49 and the father of four children. He is married to a rice farmer. With the loan, he will buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. The profits from the produce will be used to refurbish the house. He would like to see his farming expand from subsistence to more extensive rice farming in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use in the rice production.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a 30-year-old married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from 3 months to 10 years. He describes himself to be self -determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his rickshaw. He has been involved in this business for one and a half years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service the rickshaw and open another business. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service the rickshaw and open another business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 60 años de edad, casada y madre de 12 hijos. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 40 años, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a mantenido; en este negocio la apoya su familia. Su expectativa es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa ya que es donde comercializa sus productos logrando brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Solicita este crédito para comprar: aceite, carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles, verduras entre otros. Ella estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 60, is from the city of Boaco. She is married with twelve children. She is a merchant who has been selling food for 40 years. With plenty of dedication and effort, she has maintained her business. Her family supports her. Her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her home, since she sells her products there and she would like to give her clients a better service. 

She has applied for a loan to buy oil, meat, chicken, rice, beans, and vegetables, among others. She believes that this loan will be of great help to her, because she will earn a better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, chicken, rice, beans, and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Wendy Emperatriz

texts.es:
Wendy, es una persona trabajadora y está casada, disfruta de dos hijos, no recibe ayuda del exterior. Ella, posee una venta de antojitos, tales como: pupusas y entre otros, dicha actividad la realiza de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar mercadería, entre estos: repollo, chicharrón, quesillo, frijol, maíz, plátanos y otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a ofrecerle variedad de productos a su clientela y aumentar su inventario.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio y mejorar sus ventas para brindarle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is married and a hardworking married woman with two children.  She receives no outside help and sells food such as pupusas and other things.  She does this from 6:00am to 3:00pm.

She needs this loan to buy ingredients such as cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, beans, corn, plantains, and other things.  This will help her to provide a variety of products to her customers and increase her inventory.

Her dream is to grow her business and improve her sales so she can provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 48 años de edad, no estudio y esta casado; su esposa solamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar  a sus 9 hijos de. 2, 4,8, 10,12, 14, 16, 19 y 21 años de edad. 

Se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño, ya que su familia no pudo darle estudio, por lo que se vio obligado a aprender de su padre las labores del campo.  Dice que la mejor herencia que  recibió de su padre, fue aprender a trabajar y en este trabajo que realiza sus hijos también le apoyan.

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo es, para comprar abono para abonar 21,000 metros cuadrados de milpa y así obtener mejores resultados ya que con esto beneficiara a toda su familia 

Sus sueños son poder tener mejores cosechas para darles a sus hijos algo mejor.
texts.en:
Mario, 48, is married and did not study. His wife takes care of the household duties as well as their 9 children, ages 2, 4, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 19, and 21.

He has worked in agriculture from a young age. His family was not able to give him an education, so he had to learn about farm work from his father. He says that the best inheritance he received from his father was learning to work. His children also support him in his work.

He has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer for his 21,000 square meters of maize crops, thereby obtaining better results to benefit his entire family.

His dream is to have better harvests so that he can give something better to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for 21,000 square meters of maize crops.

loans.name: Amigas X Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS X SIEMPRE”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Tomasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de chamarras, tejido a macramé, tienda de abarrotes, tejido de chompas a máquina, venta de verduras, producción de sachet’s, venta de plásticos, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Tomasa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución y le hablo del trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a macramé; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al realizar apoyo a su padres, posteriormente a tener su pareja decide establecer su propio espacio de trabajo conjuntamente su pareja.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que se realiza y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "Amigas x Siempre" ("Friends Forever") communal bank is beginning its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima regional hub. This group is made up of eleven members and is run by a board of directors, of which Tomasa is president. The members' businesses are varied and include making jackets, making macrame products, a grocery store, making sweaters using a machine, selling vegetables, making sachets, selling plastic, and selling clothing.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Tomasa. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago by invitation from a friend, who is a member of the institution and told her about their work. She currently has a business making macrame products. She started her business several years ago to support her parents. Afterwards, when she was in a relationship, she decided to establish her own workplace along with her partner.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying wool from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. After making her products, she will sell them from her workplace. This work allows her to generate an income to maintain her household as much as possible, since she is in a common-law marriage with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha trabajado en esta actividad desde hace 10 años, y piensa que ha sido realmente productiva para él.  Trabaja en su caja todo el día, es soltero y no tiene hijos.  A futuro tiene la expectativa de crecer mucho más y poder incrementar su negocio también.  Actualmente necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuero, para la fabricación de calzado.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  He has worked at his business for 10 years and believes that it has been really productive.  He works at his kiosk every day.  The borrower is single and has no children.  In the future, he expects to grow even more and increase his business as well.  

The borrower currently needs a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of leather for making shoes.

loans.use: to buy leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Esther from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish, due to the location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Esther completed sixth grade and is married. She has seven children between the ages of 15 and 18. All of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

Esther has owned a shop business, selling blouses, dresses, jeans/trousers, etc. for the past ten years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase goods, such as blouses, dresses, jeans/trousers, etc.

On average, she works nine hours at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites fewer goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit. In the future, she would like to build a shop.  

She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase goods, such as blouses, dresses, jeans/trousers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hairdressing products, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 61 years old. He is married with six children, aged between 2 and 26 years. He and his wife together are rice farmers, and they have spent more than twenty years in the farming sector. With the loan, he wants to buy more fertilizers for use in the rice production. The profits from the rice farming will be used to buy a motorcycle for use in transportation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, mayonnaise, oil, butter, milk, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Harris F. M.

texts.en:
Harris F. M. lives in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. He is 34 years old and lives with his fiancee. They have three children between the ages of 7 and 16, all of whom are in school and live at home. Harris F. M. is a high school graduate and obtained a certificate in medicine. He is working toward obtaining a degree in medicine. He started this business after he obtained his certificate in medicine. 
A problem he has faced is the price of drugs, particularly because he has to purchase the medicine in USD and the exchange rate between USD and LRD is too high. He enjoys the many patients he receives every day. Whenever he does not go to his pharmacy to sell, his customers complain to him. Most importantly, his business helps to pay his children's school fees and rent. Having enough money to support his home makes him proud of his business. He is asking for a loan to purchase more drugs like cough tablets, syrups, Paracetamol, Quinine, Amodaquine, etc. so he can render good treatment for his customers. His dream is to educate his children and build a clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs for his pharmacy so he can render good treatment for his customers.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Fallah from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Fallah did not attend grade school, but he attended vocational school where he learned how to do furniture. He is married. His wife stays at home. He has two children ages 12 and 17.  His children are in school and they all live at home. 

Fallah owns his own shop in which he fixes and sells beds, chairs, arm-chairs, and other furniture, and has done this for the past nine years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase wood and other furniture materials for his business.
  
On average, he works 10 hours per day at his business. He started his business with money from his father. He transports his wood by truck. He cites the rainy season as his biggest challenge. His favorite part of his business is it is in in a good location. In the future, he would like to build a house and open another shop. He thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase wood and other furniture materials for his business.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva por nombre Renacer  se encuentra en el 9no. Ciclo del programa cuenta con 15 integrantes actualmente , es un grupo que practica la responsabilidad, solidaridad, ayuda mutua entre ellas.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Andresa de 63 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles  desde hace varios años, la venta de sus productos lo realiza por su barrio, también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza, ella gracias al crédito que pide quiere poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos en forma considerable y también la cantidad de clientes, agradece en forma personal a la Fundación Paraguaya por el crédito. Quiere poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
The Renacer group of enterprising women is in its ninth cycle of the program.  There are currently 15 members.  It is a group that practices responsibility, solidarity, and mutual help among the members.

One of the stories worthy of mention is that of Andresa, age 63.  She has been making and selling food for several years.  She sells her products in her neighborhood.  She also makes and sells cleaning products.

Thanks to the loan she asked for she wants to be able to expand her business and considerably increase her income.  She also wants to increase the number of customers that she has.  She personally thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan.  She wants to be able to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and the rest.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and the rest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fixed assets and utensils (cups, glasses, spoons) , wholesale supplies (ice cream and fruit) and remodel the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, stouts, etc. to sell at his business.

loans.name: Frank Geovanny

texts.es: El cliente reside en el sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás con esta actividad debido al que su papá está involucrado también en ella y además le parece interesante y muy fructífera.  Trabaja solo de lunes a sábado, desde las 5 am hasta las 5 pm.  No es casado y no tiene hijos.  En un futuro, tiene la idea de incrementar mucho más su negocio y sus ventas.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de artículos varios del hogar para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Orquídeas area in Guayaquil.  Some time ago he started with this business activity because his father was also involved in it.  Also, it seems very interesting and productive to him.  He works alone on Mondays through Saturdays from 5:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He is not married, and he does not have children.

In the future he plans to expand his business and his sales a lot more.  He now needs the loan to buy various household items to sell.

loans.use: to buy various household items to sell.

loans.name: Velimir

texts.en:
Velimir is a married 55-year-old man with a son and daughter who are 18 and 19 years old.  His family all lives together in a minority community in a western part of Kosovo. His wife stays at home to care for the house and take care of the family’s needs. Before the war Velimir used to work in a municipality fixing doors and windows. This was a trade that he had learned from family tradition. However, like many other people, during the war in Kosovo he lost his job.  He had to find a way to earn his income on his own.  

Velimir is a hard worker and started his own workshop for fixing doors and windows for others in the community.  He has been able to gain a lot of customers and serves all nationalities that live in his area. 

Now for the first time he needs a loan in order to renovate the roof of his workshop and to paint the workshop. This loan will help him to continue his business and to have better working conditions. Velimir wants to thank all lenders for their support!

loans.use: to renovate the roof of his workshop and to paint the workshop.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Monica to improve her business. She has a computer service, where many people come for computer services. She will buy some additional supplies such as chairs, tables, ink, and paper. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Monica independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, ink, and paper.

loans.name: Shemiah

texts.en: Shemiah is studying secondary education at Misamis University, Ozamiz City. She is single and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City with her family. Her father is a teacher and her mother worked as a private employee. She dreamed of finishing her studies to have a bright future of her own. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 14,000 PHP to pay the school tuition fees for her first semester of third year in college. She is thankful to GDMPC that gives every student a chance to continue studying with their services specialized for students.  She hopes to be successful and be able to share the blessings that she gains from her untiring effort.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her first semester of third year in college.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is a dairy producer from Tlaxcalan who makes most of his money selling artisanal yogurt. The heat required to produce his dairy products forces Pedro to spend hundreds of pesos every month on liquefied petroleum gas, an increasingly expensive fossil fuel. With his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will treat the abundant cow waste available on his farm to produce renewable, free biogas and potent biofertilizer. This will result in significant savings and decrease the negative environmental impact of Pedro's farm. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Enrogel

texts.en:
Enrogel lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, with his family. He is single with an only child. He studied his computer course at Misamis Uviversity, Ozamiz City. There were hindrances along the way, but it never stopped him from dreaming of continuing his dreamed path. 

He joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 14,000 PHP to pay the school tuition fees in his fourth year, first semester of his course. He is thankful to GDMPC that they would help him in achieving his ambition of finishing his studies for the future of his own family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for his fourth year, first semester.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Oldalia

texts.en:
Oldalia lives in Segatic Daku, Clarin with her family. She is 38 years old and has five children. To make a living, Oldalia owns and operates a charcoal sales business venture, earning 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Oldalia joined GDMPC. Oldalia successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to add to her working capital. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 32,000 PHP to purchase more coconut shells and charcoal products from adjacent barangay (villages) to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells and charcoal products from adjacent barangay (villages) to resell.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KOTOGNONGONTALA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme DJENEBA assise en première position de la droite vers la  gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognongontala II group are married women averaging 42 years of age, with six children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali. 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans.

They grow corn, which is the case of Mrs. Djeneba, for example. She is the first one seated from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to pay for the cost of labor, seeds and fertilizers to work 0.5 ha [1.2 acres] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village marketplace, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn 90,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Tegshzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tegshzaya is 45 years old and lives with her cohabitant and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She has been selling bags at a trade center by renting a stall since 2003.  She has accumulated a vast amount of experience in her business. Her cohabitant provides taxi service to local people. Her ten years old son goes to secondary school. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to purchase bags in large quantity from a border city in China. This will allow her to continue to sell her bags without worrying about inventory shortage. Tegshzaya said her dream is to see her son living happily.

loans.use: to import bags in large quantity from a border city in China.

loans.name: Jenny Rose

texts.en: Jenny Rose is 23 years old and is single. To generate income she began managing a retail store business. She has been running the business for almost a year. She usually receives a net income of 250 PHP per day from the business and uses this to cover her family's daily needs. She is asking for a loan to buy various groceries such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted breads and beverages to sell. Jenny Rose hopes that she will receive her desired loan in order to make further improvement to the business.

loans.use: to buy various groceries such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted breads and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La cliente es la Sra .Claudia es soltera y es dueña de una despensa y Peluquería en su casa, hace más de 5 años en donde vende productos de primera necesidad y también en el mismo predio tiene su peluquería.
Ella es una persona que se está esforzando por salir adelante, es por eso que está trabajando duro para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para pode invertirlo en la compra de verduras, gaseosas, comestibles, productos a granel, y demás, y así seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
Sra.Claudia is single and the owner of a grocery store and hair salon which she runs out of her home. She's had the store for more than five years and has the hair salon in the same location.

Claudia is very keen to improve her lot in life and so she works very hard to be able to help her family. She plans to use the loan money to buy vegetables, soft drinks, food items, bulk foods, etc. and continue to give her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, soft drinks, food items, bulk products, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras y está en su ciclo número 26 del programa de comité, es un grupo que ya hace bastantes ciclos están trabajando juntas y se nota la unión que llevan. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas trabajan por mejorar sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Joaquina, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que ella siempre trata de instar a sus amigas a seguir trabajando y luchando, esforzarse y dar todo de si para ir creciendo. Joaquina es modista, y comenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela y que gracias a su buen trabajo es muy conocida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y así seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes, e ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Emprendedoras" [Entrepreneurial Women] is in its 26th group loan cycle. This group has been working together for many loan cycles and it is clear they are very united.

This group is participating in the poverty elimination survey*, through which each member of the group is working to improve their income.

One of the members of this group is Joaquina, the president of the group, and it is worth noting that she always tries to motivate her friends to continue working, striving, strengthening themselves and giving it their all to continue growing. 

Joaquina is a seamstress who has a very good client base and is well known for the quality of her work. She requests this loan to invest in fabrics and thread, which she will use to fill the orders of her clients and improve her economic situation.


*See the organization description below for more information on the poverty elimination survey, part of Fundación Paraguaya's "Poverty Stoplight" program.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa ya está en su ciclo número 11º  del programa de comité gracias a que todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas quieren saber la situación en la que se encuentran.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir con buen ingreso, pero ella debe de seguir trabajando para mantener estables esos ingresos. Ella realiza compra-venta de ropas,  se debe destacar la predisposición y las ganas de salir adelante que tiene esta señora, es por eso que se esfuerza mucho.
La Sra. Claudia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, y demás tipos de prendas.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is already in its eleventh loan cycle and has used the loan money to help them get ahead. They are participating in a special poverty eradication program in which each woman identifies her own particular situation.

One of the group members is Sra. Claudia. In the last survey she had a level 3 poverty ranking; in other words, she has an adequate income but has to work hard to maintain it. She buys and sells clothing. Claudia is very keen to make progress in life and for this reason she makes a great effort. With the loan money she plans to buy a variety of clothes to sell such as t-shirts, shirts, pants etc.

loans.use: Buy clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda has a business selling vegetables, fruits and some groceries. She earns an average of 400 PHP per day in the business which she uses for their daily living necessities. She has four children and she also invests some of her earnings for their education. She has observed that she isn't able to save for future uses and is asking for financial support to further develop her vending business to get higher sales. She will use the loan to buy potatoes, bitter melon, pechay, cabbage, sugar, oil, and some canned goods.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, bitter melon, pechay, cabbage, sugar, oil, and some canned goods.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is married with two children. She runs her general store in Montol, Ozamiz City. Her husband is a part-time driver, and he also helps her operate her business for a living. She has been in her business for 17 years, earning much to augment their living situation. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative that she used to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional goods like rice, first aid medicine and feeds for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchace additional goods like rice, first aid medicine and feeds for sale

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado SAN JUAN está en su ciclo número NOVENO del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de su esfuerzo, y con las capacitaciones que recibe están tratando de mejorar sus vidas y la de sus familias. Son destacadas en el barrio por ser unidas y solidarias las unas a las otras.
Martha es una persona humilde, que con mucho sacrificio esta ayudando a su familia y dándoles lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, o como es llamado en Paraguay, remedios yuyos. Es un trabajo sacrificado, pero por sobre todo muy digno.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertir en su negocio, y tener más remedios yuyos para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The San Juan group is on its ninth cycle with the women's communal bank program. They are resilient women, who though their efforts and the training that they receive, are trying to improve their lives and those of their families. They stand out in the neighborhood because they are united and stand in solidarity with each other. Martha is a humble person who, with a lot of sacrifice, is helping her family and giving them what they need so that they do not have to do without like she did. She works selling herbal remedies, or as they are called in Paraguay, "remedios yuyos". It is demanding work, but very dignified above all. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in her business, and to have more herbal remedies to sell. She is grateful for this opportunity that will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies to sell
